text: Last night, I went to this place based on a comp given to me.  There was a specific menu given to me with a few options.  I chose the chicken fajitas which were actually pretty good.  It was lots of meat.  I did have to add some salt and pepper but I was okay with that.  The service was good as well. There was no pressure to buy additional items.  They did come around and take pics for a personal postcard.  The pic for my husband and I were really good so I bout it, but again there was no pressure and I still got the initially promised free postcard.  Overall the experience was good.

We have been in Vegas since Sunday and this was the second time we ate here. I was pretty skeptical because of the reviews but by the time I saw them, we'd already been seated inside.

Trip 1 was for dinner. The restaurant was pretty empty but the service was excellent and so was the food. I had a chicken fajita burrito with rice and beans on the side. It was delicious. I thought the reviews were wrong. The only negative was the pricing seemed a little high. 

Wellllll, trip 2 was the absolute opposite experience. We went for breakfast this time. They drew us in with 99 cent bloody marys. They were good... Had to order doubles so they came in a standard glass and not a kiddie cup.  

The service was slow (and slow is being nice). Our waitress was horrible. It took at least 10 minutes for her to even come over after we were seated. We ordered our drinks and she asked for our IDs. I was having trouble finding mine in my purse and our drinks came out before she came back to look at the ID which I thought was funny. It should have been a clue as to how "on top of things" she'd be. 

Anyway, we ordered food and once the food came, she brought our bill, told us to let her know if we needed anything else, and scurried off before we could order another round and ask her to separate our checks.  She didn't come back for at least 15 minutes and that's no exaggeration. At that point, she tried to take our bill -- which had no payment in it because we weren't finished. We ordered our second round and requested out bills be separated. The waitress told us that she would need to find the manager to do that and acted as if it was a major inconvenience.

Again, she didn't come back for about 15 minutes. In the mean time, I watched her dig in the trash can on two separate occasions looking for things she'd thrown away.... Who knows if she washed her hands. 

She finally saw me staring at her and I guess she remembered we needed our bills. She brought them and since I paid with my card, she wanted to see my ID again. I really couldn't have gotten out of there any faster.  It was a terrible experience.

The only reason I rated this place two stars and not one was because of the dinner experience.

Ate dinner here on a Saturday night.  Their customer service was fantastic.  Had the nachos as a starter and they were pretty good as far as nachos go.  Dinner was DELICIOUS!!.  I had a burrito with roasted carnitas and green chile sauce on top.  My aunt had enchiladas with green chile sauce on top.  Both came with rice and beans (I had pinto).

I would like to go here again and bring my husband.  They have a fun food challenge.  If you can finish their yard margarita and giant burrito, you get a t-shirt.  Even if you can't finish it, the meal is a great deal.  Not sure if they would let you order and split, forfeiting the challenge, but would be worth a try.
Really good Nachos! We stopped in for a snack, and were very impressed! We shared them and are both stuffed!!

nice lil spot if you come with someone who like to dance to salsa..... not my favorite spot in the world .... I was not to fond of the way they speak to guest I know they deal with a lot of drunk ass people but you should still have a sense of good character... 
Tips: go to the bar and order yourself , waitresses are rude and take forever to get you served.

Nothing special.  That's about it.  I had a craving for some nachos - average.  My husband had the enchladas - again, average.  I tried a pina colada - super average.  The service - not so great.  We went for lunch.  It wasn't crowded.  In fact, I didn't see many people.  And yet it was hard to get the waitress to the table.

I was surprised to see such low reviews here because my experience was great. We had a late night and manage to get out on the strip just as most restaurants stopped serving breakfast (11 am). We were dying for some yummy breakfast since the day before we had the worst breakfast burritos known to man at Tacos and 'Ritas at the MGM Grand food court. We were happy to see this place served breakfast until 12. They also advertised a 3.95 special (eggs, potato, breakfast meat of choice) and 99 cent bloody Mary's. Everything was delicious. The only complaint was that my tortillas were a little dry. The home style potatoes were delicious and the bacon seemed to be higher quality then your average franchise diner.  

Our expectations were low because of the price, but it seemed like they blew them out of the water. I have no clue how good the rest of their food is, but you can't beat the breakfast for that price!

WOWWWWWW. This place sucked. 

Simply put, this place charges way too much money for low-quality food.

I hate that this is the first place I've reviewed that is forcing me to give it a one-star rating. I almost wanted to give it two stars because the carnitas in my tacos was pretty good, but the rest of the food and the entire experience was pretty underwhelming.

My boyfriend ordered the chicken fajita quesadilla appetizer and he said he had about two pieces of chicken in it. He was really disappointed with the taste.

I ordered the Two Tacos platter of carnitas. The tacos were all right, nothing special. I reeeeally tried to eat the rice and beans, but it was not happening. I tried eating them over and over and the taste kept putting me off. They just tasted so inauthentic and old.

I also ordered the almost $3 chips and salsa (I don't know why I paid for chips and salsa -_-) and those were just mediocre. Everything I ate pretty much tasted like it had been microwaved a million times or had that inauthentic store-bought taste. Bleghhh.

That's all we ordered and the total was almost $30. Luckily we drank water, but if we had ordered soft drinks or anything more expensive our total would have been at least $35. It was REALLY badly overpriced.

The service wasn't great, either. Nothing to rave or rant about.

I feel like I work hard for my dollar and I was so sorry I had wasted so much money in one place.

I will not go here again and I would not recommend this place.

Love drinking at the bar here.  Really good specials.  Brandon the bartender is fantastic!!!  Very friendly.  They use real strawberries for their margaritas.  Makes them so good.  When I order food it has always been good.  My only issue is they don't serve refried beans which I love.  They said its because they are a tex mex place.  Really like coming here especially because of Brandon.

It is quite difficult to find reasonably priced, good quality food on the Las Vegas strip. La Salsa Cantina is one decent option. The food is fairly good, I had the fajita burrito which is a nice variation from your typical burrito. The service and drinks leave a bit to be desired unfortunately.

What a great place for breakfast!  We headed here because the night before we saw signs advertising  $4.79 breakfast and 99 cent Bloody Marys. Once we looked at the menu we saw a huge array of scrambles, omets and more for under $10. I got the huevos rancheros and hubby got the Southwest scramble. We each had two bloody Mary's which were smaller than expected but still a delicious bargain for the price. Food was great and service even better. Fantastic breakfast for under $30 including coffee!
Love this place ! Great food and amazing drinks! A really fun atmosphere!

It's not the worst food ever. Kind of just did this restaurant stuff spontaneously. I had the grilled fish tacos and they were pretty good, wasn't a fan of rice and beans. The guacamole was really good. 

The alcohol, 48 oz margarita, was absolutely great. I had strawberry and mango. It's like $20 for the biggest one. 

Our server was really nice, she had a lot on her plate so just a little slow. Overall, an okay experience.

The $3.95 breakfast special is what called out to us as we walked down the strip... we we're all for it but what ruined this place for me was their DISGUSTING coffee.  The server told me prior that it was colombian coffee but I can't believe it because it was the most horrid, watered down coffee I've had in such a long time.  I tried it both hot and iced mind you.  The breakfast on the other hand was pretty good but theres no way in hell I'd return.  Breakfast and coffee go together like a hand and glove - they need to improve this situation pronto if their charging close to $3 a cup!   PS- There is a Starbucks right next store to save you if need be.  Good luck folks...

This one was located at the Miracle Mile. The service was great. We were seated quickly and the waitress was nice, but.....   I ordered the fish tacos.  

Never again.  I was served two tacos with one over overcooked tiny fish stick in each taco. Even the rice and beans were awful. I've had better Rice a Roni spanish rice.

For good cheap fish tacos go to Rubios !!!!

Stopped in here on a tuesday in january for a yard drink. The bartender was awesome, just a really nice and cool genuine chick. She poured us two strong margos in the yard cups. My girlfriend had a blended mango margo and I went for the top shelf on the rocks. We also had an order of nachos. The bill came out to around $55 with a tip. I was not expecting much from this place and it turned out to be a great value. Those yard drinks are prolly like 5-6 regular drinks so for 16-20 bucks its a great deal. One negative would be the hostess who what quite the little prissy b***ch I felt like throwing my yard margo on her. Theres bad apples everywhere.
So disappointed.  Better off going to Taco Bell. Don't even know if it was Beef or the dog from the back alley.  I guess I should have recognized that the place was empty

Good service. We came in for dinner and were greeted and seated immediately. Our order was taken quickly and drinks promptly brought to us. The waiter was friendly, polite and attentive. 
The chips and salsa were good, comes with 4 salsas. I liked the spicy and mild (which was still spicy) best, my husband enjoyed the mango. The last was an avocado salsa, but neither of us eat avocado so we didn't try it. I got chicken enchiladas in flour tortillas with the red sauce. They had a lot of flavor. After I few minutes I remembered I didn't order with no avocado, I hate avocado. I told the waiter and he rushed to make sure there was none on my plate since our food was almost ready to come out. My husband had the green chile chicken burrito. It was large and he said also had a lot of flavor and a good kick to it. The rice was ok but the black beans were so tasty. I don't usually eat them, but I ate almost the entire serving. 
I would return here and would recommend it to a friend.

I went to this restaurant after a long day's travel with my girlfriend and a bit of shopping at the Miracle Mile.  I had been there in the past.  Once again, I was not disappointed.  

I had the Taco Salad, it was fresh, cold and crisp.  My girlfriend had Taquito Sunrises which were also very good.  

The ambiance was nice as we had a table near the mall's water fountain.  The music a little loud at times, but if you like to be in a little action out of the heat, this a good place to be.  Service was just right, the server was polite and courteous.

We each had a drink and main dish for less than $40 for both of us.  If you are looking for good Mexican food with no frills and good service, this is a place to go.

Cheap, tasty eats right on the strip! 0.99 bloody mary's are hard to beat! They are a bit on the small side, but for 0.99 it:s hard to beat. Sweet little spot in the miracle mile shops. Highly recommend.

Breakfast is a bargain here, and pretty good!  You get two eggs, 2 tortillas, breakfast potatoes, and your choice of bacon, sausage, or ham for under $5 before noon. They also have coffee or a Bloody Mary for .99 cents. :)

Also came here for happy hour from 3-7pm...cheap drinks and apps. Will be back for sure!

We had lunch here today. The waiter had informed the owner, Bob, that our order had taken longer than expected.  Bob came over to our table and  apologized, stating that lunch was on him.  My two girlfriends and I, were surprised to hear this since it was totally unexpected, but we were so appreciative. This is exceptional customer service, not to mention that the food was absolutely delicious. We definitely will return to La Salsa Cantina - great ambience and friendly servers, along with great cooks! It's location is in the right place -- inside Planet Hollywood's Mile of Shops and the V Theater.

we stopped by here on the way out of the miracle mile shops on our last day.  the food was really tasty, i had a carne asada burrito and it was a really good buritto.  prices didnt' seem too steep in my opinion, typical sit down mexican restaurant prices ($13ish for the burrito).  they do have the 50 ounce margaritas in the tall vegas type cup, but it is kinda pointless to pay that much for it when it only has 3 shots of alcohol in it (we asked the bartender).  better off spending the money at fat tuesday and getting extra shots of everclear for a dollar.  but the food was good, portions were large so we were happy
The margaritas are some of the best I've ever had.  The burrito was perfect, I devoured it.  We ate here several times during our stay.

We found ourselves tooling through the forum shoppes one day on our recent trip to LV around lunchtime.  I had been craving Mexican, so we of course we stopped to check the mall Directory and voila!  We see La Salsa!  I was so excited!!  Little did I know............

It looked so cute when we went inside and then we noticed a great outdoor patio with a bar.  I think this must be the attraction, margaritas outside, that allows them to continue to stay in the forum shoppes and make money.  B/c our food was dire, bland, tasteless and all around the worst Mexican food I have ever had.

And I do not say this lightly, I truly am the last person to be overly critical b/c every restaurant can have a bad day.  But this food was insipid and terrible-- PLEASE do not eat here.  There are so many other options, I wish we had taken one of them instead.

Having to pay extra for chips and salsa at a place called "La Salsa Cantina" is bad. When they are served broken into small pieces and crumbs is worse.  The food is your standard Mexican fare and is average at best. I might be hyper critical because I'm from Los Angeles.   I suppose if you were visiting from Peoria you might think it's the best Mexican food ever. Las Vegas is a melting pot of visitors from around the world.  Angelinos should not eat here.  It's not El Tepeyac.

Absolutely amazing place for breakfast! 1.99 double margaritas and breakfast for less than 5 bucks. Good food, great service! If you are looking for a great tart to a day or maybe even a hangover cure be sure to stop here!

I ate there alone and had the steak tacos. It was served with beans and rice. The food was good and the presentation was nice. But the atmosphere is nothing spectacular. It's pretty typical for a Mexican restaurant. 

The waitress was not very personable. She seemed to have too many tables. She didn't offer a refill on my drink. 

Overall this place was just average. I would go there again and I would recommend it.

The only reason I give this 2 stars is because the food was pretty good. 
Now the bad. 
First my friend and I sat at the bar to get something to eat, sat there about ten minutes, the bartender didn't even look at us. but we were there so we just opted to get a table instead. It was about 10:50 and we wanted lunch food.  WRONG. lunch there, for whatever reason, doesn't start until 11:00 on the dot. What's up with that??? and also once we got a table, it took a while to have a waitress come over to take our order. I will not be going there again.
Order the Taco Salad! It's delicious. The shell is crispy and delicious. The prices aren't bad either.

The food was not amazing and we literally spent 30 minutes arguing with the manager about our bill.  The prices are listed differently on the menu, we ordered food from the menu (even pointed at specific drinks) but were surprised when the prices came back as double. They also added gratuity for 8 people where there were 6... Bad experience. 

BUT they have us all a shot of tequila at the end for the huge struggle.

Last day of our stay in Vegas for a catering convention and came to the shops to hang out till we got picked up for our trip to the airport. Had a hankering for Mexican. 

I ordered the fish taco beef taco combo and it was good. Nothing to write home about but was flavorful and the steak wasn't tough. 

A good end to a nice vegas trip

My boyfriend and I decided to walk through the Miracle Mile Mall located on the Vegas strip, it was about around dinner time and it was my birthday and I really wanted Mexican food, so this was the only Mexican place we saw on the directory. We got seated right away, no line at all. It was also during happy hour so I got a margarita. The margarita was VERY sugary. I ordered a chicken enchilada with a steak taco and rice. We shared our meal since he wasn't very hungry. The rice was a 1 our of 5. The enchilada was a 2 our of 5. we had to buy chips and salsa, which I thought that was weird, usually you get that for free. They also took our picture and have a deal for $25 where you get both pictures with one frame and they give you a free postcard size with a small picture and information about their restaurant. Our waitress gave us 2 free tickets to a show. But we weren't interested in them. Then my boyfriend asked for the bill. She brought us our bill and he paid but we had to go find her and ask for our change. We sat and waited for a few minutes to see if she would come back to our table and bring us our change. I was very disappointed in this restaurant. I will never go back to this place. Great for drinks besides the margaritas.
Went here multiple times on our trip, food was really good & priced well. Cheap breakfast & good service
Amazing place to go dine in with friends or family. Staff is friendly and the food is prepared fast. I enjoyed the ambience at this restaurant I totally recommend and I would suggest it to everyone

La Salsa in California is a take out fast food type place that at least has a self serve salsa bar with a few 'fresh' salsa choices. My friends and I ate at La Salsa Cantina on the strip and couldn't believe our quesadillas came with chips and sour cream...but no salsa. We asked for salsa and it appeared we had asked for shredded black truffles so we said we'll take an order of chips and salsa; that seemed to compute better and btw also costs $2.95. Problem solved? No! We finally got salsa and we all ate it at the same time and said the same thing....' It tastes like a jar of salsa from the supermarket'. Come on now! The name of the establishment has the word salsa in it!!!!

Ate dinner here a couple times and was unimpressed with it both times.  Super Americanized Mexican food at Vegas prices.  

BUT I do go back every time for a dreamsicle.  By far, my favorite drink in Vegas.  You can just go up to the bar and order it to go.  They also have a branch in the mall next to Planet Hollywood.  The La Salsa outside of The Forum Shops does not serve dreamsicles though.  Sad.

After a disastrous attempt at another eating  establishment in PH, my friends and I went to the Cantina after a comedy club show and were greeted right away and seated almost immediately at our table.  The manager (I believe his name was Manuel and our server Leticia) as well as others greeted us and were very pleasant.  Our food came in a reasonable time, it presented well and they were very gracious in allowing my husband to substitute his rice and beans for a salad.  They let us know their nightly special and worked well with us. I enjoyed their food as well as their service.  My friend ordered some nachos that were a little lacking in chicken but she still stated that it was good and was pleased over all.  Thank you La Cantina.  Good job!

Thanks!

This is my second visit over a few years. The service is great and the serving sizes are good for the price.   My 12 year old son was craving tacos during our sightseeing visit and this place really hit the spot!  Good for families!

NOT YOUR TYPICAL LA SALSA.  The "Cantina" concept has more food offerings and better food.  It's also the original by the yard frozen margarita in Vegas!!!

I prefer this location to the one on the strip because you can save 20% off your entire bill by visiting the Miracle Mile concierge and getting a coupon book (officially, it's for any AAA member).  And yes, it's also good on the margaritas!  

Disappointed that they no longer offer comp chips and salsa but their food is much better than Cabo Wabo's.  

I recommend the mexican pizza, fajita quesadilla (my favorite), or any of the fajitas.  

Sit outside in the "faux patio" and enjoy good eats and your by the yard margarita while people watching.  Holla!

HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!  AVOID THIS PLACE.  WOW, WHY DO I HAVE TO GIVE THEM A STAR AT ALL?  We sat for nearly 20 minutes and just got up and left because the 3 employees standing around talking about BS paid no attention to us and all we were asking for were menus and a couple glasses of water.  There were no other people around us.  Will never go to this WASTE OF A PLACE again.  We went to the burger place right across from them and it ruled.  Cant remember what it was called but the food was great and service was too. 

DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME IN THIS PLACE.  VERY BAD AND NON EXISTENT SERVICE.  If I owned this restaurant, I would fire all the losers that wait there.  I am sure the cooking staff is very good, but the WAIT STAFF IS A TOTAL JOKE!  We heard that before, and now we know for sure.  Avoid them and maybe the bums that own the place will replace the losers.  Maybe they should let the cooks wait on people and get rid of the dumb asses they have now.  If you still decide to try the food, good luck and I hope you enjoy enjoy it.  I will never know if it is worth eating, but I do hope you are not in a hurry.

Idk why this place has such a bad rating. I would never come here for a romantic dinner, but for a quick lunch this place was perfect! Of course the prices are high it's right on the strip, but they have a Groupon that helped. They also have someone come around and take a picture of your table, you get a free postcard pic even if you don't buy the framed pic they try to sell you. Not that exciting but it was fun. The food was good and they breaded the fish for my tacos even tho it wasn't on the menu. Plus I heard they have 99 cent bloody Mary's for breakfast, what!

Usually when you think a $3.99 breakfast, you don't set the bar very high. But La Salsa blew me away. Two eggs any style, choice of sausage or bacon and country potatoes and a coffee or tea kept us coming here every morning while we were in Vegas!

Went here on a Sunday afternoon.  Waitress took order and brought drinks.  Did not offer refills (or really come back to our table) until the bill was presented.  Ordered a burrito that was $1 worth of meat and cheese, a greasy tortilla, and some black beans.  If you ask for salsa, they will charge you a buck for it (but not tell you until you get the bill).  The food is waaay overpriced, and I would avoid it like the sickness that you will most likley get in the form of food poisoning (which most of our party did.. since we did not have anything else that day to eat or drink except our meal here).  AVOID THIS PLACE!!!

With the restaurant more than half empty during dinner service, I would expect service to be exceptionally faster. After we were seated, we waited for the wait staff to offer us a drink (which is instantaneous in most restaurants) or ask what we'd like to eat. We got neither after waiting more than 5 minutes. We then left.

We went for a breakfast. I got the steak and eggs and my boyfriend got the quesadilla . Everything was super delicious the steak was tender and the eggs were delicious. I got them over medium and they were cooked perfection. We also ordered morning drinks. The breakfast margarita was delicious but the mimosa was sub par. Definitely go with morning margarita

I'm surprised this place doesn't have better reviews. The food is always super good (they have the best queso dip)! Not only that, the staff is friendly & really on top of things. The food is a reasonable price as well; for $18.95 I got chicken fajitas which filled me up & I still had some to take home. Only thing I didn't really like is that they have grilled chicken instead of shredded chicken & you have to pay $2.95 for chips & salsa. Besides that, I would recommend to anyone touring around that area! Good fried ice cream & even better churros!

I was at the restaurant next to M&M World. We loved the 2/6.00 Corona's, the. 99 bloody Marys and the 3.95 breakfast special (2 eggs 2 Bacon or sausage, 2 flour tortillas and a mound of potatoes. Very good food there... we went 4 of the 5 days in Vegas. Vegas us ridiculously expensive and this place was a great find.
overpriced, small portions. There's far better food for the same price range.
I have to admit I really enjoyed my chile-lime shrimp salad, but Joel made the experience great. If you're smart you'll request him as a server. Hope management realizes he is one of their best.

Been here so many times. I Everytime I've been there the waitresses are running around in a panic and there's usually two hostesses standing there doing nothing. I asked her for takeout menu and she said she wasn't sure where they were. What is the point of your hostesses. To stand there all day. Taking my money elsewhere.

Good food, but they conveniently charged me for $71 in addition to the $41 they charged me for the meal. I called the next day and they said it was a "mistake" and I could come down for confirmation of the reversal of the charge.  I went and they did could not give me anything, but if I came back after 4 pm someone might be able to help me.  Too much wasted time and aggravation on a vacation with the family.  Stay far away, or bring cash and check your bill.

I eat here every time I come to Las Vegas. I love the salsa here, and the chips are good. I normally order shrimp nachos and share, but my for my solo trip I ordered 2 tacos with rice.  I was a little disappointed when they arrived with iceberg lettuce and tomatoes.  After scraping that off, the tacos were pretty tasty. They tasted more Americanized than a lot of tacos I have had, and they were good.

Whenever I'm seeing a show at Planet Hollywood I frequently swing by La Salsa Cantina beforehand for margaritas and nachos. Wait staff is typically friendly, prices are decent and so is the food. And the wait time has been non-existent every time I've eaten there.

This La salsa is located inside of the Planet Hollywood

I've only been here once @ lunch time, i got the Grande Burrito w/ carnitas, with rice and black beans. it tasted fine, tho i was just going for a quick lunch and i wasn't expecting fireworks. 

My boyfriend got a combination plate of some sort, he however was less impressed. 

They charge separately for chips and salsa ($2.50) (not uncommon of the strip) and the Salas's weak and bland in flavor.

I'd like to try one of their margaritas by the yard. org fruit 18.95/ top shelf 24.95 and 1.95 for an extra shot.

If you don't mind bad service and cheap mediocre food this is your place to eat.  The breakfast deal that they have is what caught our eye.  My friends and I just wanted to get something in our stomachs.  We thought it will be quick fast food but we were wrong.  The service here is just HORRIBLE.  After we were seated, we did not get any service for about 15 min.  We were ready to leave.  They didn't ask us for water  or grab our order.  When a server arrived, we placed our order in and hoped we get our food quick.  Like I said in the beginning the food was mediocre but since the pricing was cheap we expected it.  Do yourself a favor and find another place.

Eh, just OK. Carnitas fajitas were salty... Maybe they ran out of Mexican spices? They were edible but would not order those again. The waitress went on break just after we were served our meals and let us know another waitress would be taking care of us. She didn't come by once and we waited some time before we could get the check and leave.

Breakfast $4.29 includes two eggs any style, ham or bacon, wheat or corn tortillas, and Southwest potatoes. 
Delicious way to start the morning. The ambience of the miracle mile with the blue sky and clouds above make outdoor dining, indoor dining, so weather is not effective. Highly recommend. Ask for Maria
Initially had a bad experience with the service, but the server quickly turned it around. This wasn't my first choice but moving forward it could be.
We ordered Cantons Sampler and it was so delicious.  I kind of thought wouldn't be enough for 2 people but it was. Very nice place with a great service...

This place was ridiculous! I payed almost thirty dollars for two tacos and a margerita...what the hell! AND TO MAKE MATTERS WORSE, it wasnt even busy and our server took his sweet time taking our order and at one point I saw him come out, look at us,and went back and brought me my food which was edible but for the price I payed I could have gone to a regular taco stand and fed like 3 people with what I paid for two tacos! Then I had to wait almost half an hour for the bill which by the way I only got because the manager happened to walk by and asked if we needed something. Mediocre food, poor service, and really over priced for what you get.
The food is pretty good, but I love the energy and the location! :)

Came here today before leaving Vegas. It was my first time here and I have to say I was disappointed. I ordered the enchiladas with steak and they had no flavor. The enchilada sauce tasted like it came out of a can. My boyfriend got the ranchero burrito and he said it was OK. The only good thing was that we had a good waitress, but that isn't enough to have me come back. I would  suggest that you skip this restaurant.

Cheap Breakfast!  Okay, so the coffee isn't great, and the food isn't awesome, but for the price, 2 eggs, meat, taters and tortillas (as opposed to toast), I'm not going to complain a whole lot, except about the coffee.  The coffee was pretty bad and had to be doctored with cream/sugar pretty extensively.

Service was very very friendly.  The place was clean, and more importantly, the silverware was clean (unlike the place next door).

Good food, good service, bad coffee. Pretty good, just not good enough to make me a fan.

Came here for breakfast while staying at the Hilton Grand Vacation hotel attached to PH. I didn't have high expectations but it was pretty good. I had the California Omelet which was tasty. And some coffee. They didn't have Soy milk. It's kind of weird eating breakfast under the fake sky and surrounded by the general tackiness of this shopping area. Also the non stop flickering neon lights got tiring after a while. Good value and good service.

Food was alright.  A little pricey but then again your in vegas. Appetizers were about $15 bucks and a catilac margarita was $12. When we got the bill we were a little upset to see a 17% gratuity added to our check of 7 ppl for bland, unenthusiast and dull service.  It was definitely not worth it!!!!!
Hanging out in Las Vegas, looking for a good breakfast with good service at a great price - this is where to go.
Did not like it. Service was poor. Waitress couldn't understand me and had to repeat  myself constantly. Food was lousy and way overpriced. Find another place for dinner.

Stopped by for breakfast, and was so happy to see coffee was only 99 cents! Many other breakfast places advertise cheap breakfast ($5-$6), but then a cup of coffee is $3. Not here! Coffee and Bloody Mary (with breakfast) just 99 cents. We ordered the breakfast special, which was two eggs any way, bacon, ham or sausage, delicious home fries and two tortillas for $4.29 (plus 99 cents for coffee). The breakfast was very delicious and a great value. A good, light breakfast if you're about to go to the pool or walk the strip (doesn't leave you uncomfortable). I have never gone for other food or for drinks, so I can't comment on that. 

They take your photo during your meal and say it's complimentary, then try to get you to purchase them for $15+. I would have rated 5 stars, but the lady who took our photo was pretty ticked when we declined buying our photos, and that made me a bit uncomfortable. 

Overall, if you're looking for a cheap breakfast with decent, cheap coffee, you have found your spot!

$3.99 breakfast made to order. Best breakfast deal on the strip if you ask me. Their Mexican breakfast potatoes were so yummy. Biscuits are gravy were served bubbly hot and were delicious! This restaurant is located inside miracle mile shopping mall, next to planet Hollywood.
Yummy, Cinco de Mayo action! Very flavorful Verde sauce, and fresh ingredients! Adequate service, a tad loud location, but can't complain about the excellent food!

After walking thru the miracle mile shopping center in Planet Hollywood I was starving. Mexican food sounded good so I shared steak and chicken fajitas with my boyfriend. 

The food was actually pretty decent but getting the food took forever! We waited for forever just to get our drinks and pretty much had to hunt someone down to order our food. Even after getting our food the waiter forgot about us, so then I had to hunt him down again to get more drinks. The service was horrible! Every person from the lady seating us to our waiter must have been having a horrible day because they were anything but friendly!

They had a photographer walking around who would take pictures of each table and give you a post card of the picture for free. She would then offer other pictures that of course cost money and boy oh boy! Beware, if you don't want these photos she gets upset! It's hard to have a nice lunch with such negative people surrounding you!

On the plus side, we sat outside which was great for people watching! Overall I would probably pass on eating at this place again. There are so many other restaurants in Vegas that have better service and even tastier food.

We came here for dinner tonight.  We have been to La Salsa in SoCal, but while the logo is similar, this place was different.

The good:
Salsa was fresh
My hubby really liked his taco entree
The chips were good.

The bad:
There was only one salsa - mild - when CA La Salsa has a salsa bar that is very good.
They charge for chips and salsa
They charge you to pay with a credit card
We had to ask for refills on our water

The food was good - it could have been 4 star, but the service was subpar.

I went to this place for a bite to eat. I asked the bartender to make me a non-alcoholic drink, something with pineapple in it. He couldn't. He didn't have the proper ingredients to make it! I ordered the Nachos with chicken, not bad, but the chicken was barely visible. It was pretty tasty though. The bartender was the only one there so getting any attention from him was almost null when the football loving husband of a woman sitting at the bar appeared.

The worst thing was when I went to leave. I pushed the bar stool back and put my foot on the ground, but the bar stool was not moving and it tilted back and I went for a very nice fall! The bartender came out and the manager. I told him the bar stool didn't move back it tilted and I lost my balance. He gave me this look like I must be drunk. The bartender told him I hadn't been drinking. Although, I wasn't hurt right then I was sore and bruised the nest day and my back was sore and achy. Nothing was done. No report, nothing.

We were going to gamble and see a show on  a Friday night. Had some time so we went walking in the shops that are inside around the casino looking for a place to eat. We went into the bar here and their Happy Hour deals aren't bad. The hostess told us that the apps are all half price as is some of the alcohol.
I got the nachos, a friend got the wings and another got the jalapeno poppers. All items came in a small paper 'boat' type holder. Nachos, small but enough if not too hungry. $6. The poppers were only 3 with fries all in one boat. $7 and not worth it. The wings, 3 pieces and fries and not worth the $7. The margaritas were good at $3.50 each. came in a draft beer glass, not a margarita glass. One friend got a glass of wine. Anyways, I'd say that if circumstances are that you want a quick bite then try it, otherwise, take your chances somewhere else in the area. 
The hostess that told us of the half price apps should have told us that they were HALF SIZE. A man and woman sat at the bar near us, ordered the regular price nachos and it was MUCH MORE than double the size of the nachos I got and only double the price.
Oh, and if you want chips and salsa, it is $3.
Three stars instead of 2 only because it is the Strip and you have to expect to get ripped off some.
I had a wonderful chicken taco salad. The margarita was fantastic. Decent ambience and service. An extra charge for using a debit or credit card? Yes, and tell me after the bill comes. Just stupid.

My friend and I went to this place over the weekend. We ordered nachos, taquitos, carne asada and a combination plate. The servers were very nice, but the service itself was quite slow. It took about 20 minutes from the time we ordered until we got the apps and then another 25 minutes from then for our meals. 
The food was very bland. It made me sad because the presentation was nice, so I was sure it would  be flavorful, but I was disappointed. 
I would recommend this place only for drinks and maybe chips and salsa. Everything was kinda boring.
Great for breakfast, inexpensive, and tasty! The $.99 Bloody Mary was delicious also.

I would give it 5 stars, but we only ate chips & salsa. We stopped here however because we saw a sign for a $5 bloody mary. We went in to the bar & found ourselves being waited on by Brandon, whom had worked there for 5 years. He was super friendly & made us killer drinks as well as provided us with some good conversation & entertainment. He also gave us great information on where we should go out & where not to waste our time. He deserves his tips by far!

I got those Yard drink things.  I was super happy. 

I got a great vegetarian burrito and side of rice bean beans.  I was quite content.

4 stars instead of 5? 

The price KILLED me.  For how much I paid, I could have fed a family of 3 for everywhere else in the world.  But it is Las Vegas.

Absolutely the worst restaurant to attend!! Like we had to wait to get seated, we had to wait to order our food and we had to wait to pay for our bill. Like what the heck. All of the workers ignored is the whole time. I know they could hear us. But walked off like they didn't. Never coming back again

This is for the La Salsa Cantina location in Planet Hollywood Casino Miracle Mile shops.

I had breakfast and tried the $3.95 breakfast special, it came with eggs, bacon, and potatoes, the portion size was small, I am glad I had one biscuit with gravy on the side.  The coffee was strong and hot, the service was good since the place was not very busy, it was about 8am on a Saturday.

The only drawback I saw was the hostess that seats people could have been more on the ball, there were people waiting to be seated and she was nowhere in site, since the place was not busy at all, I could see her being more courteous and helpful.  Our server was very nice and helpful though.

For the price I paid, the total bill for two people was less that $20.00, I would maybe look around more next time if I was to try any of the other places in the Miracle Mile shops area that serve breakfast.

We came in for the  $4. 29 breakfast special and 99 cent bloody marys or coffee. It is available everyday from 8 a.m. til noon the food was decent the portion was ok and the service was good too it is nice to sit on the outside bar and watch people walk through the mall you can see the fountain and everything that's going on I do believe we will be coming back.  Side note the wife loves a spicy Bloody Mary

Great experience with this restaurant. We come here for breakfast and they have a good deal for 4.99 with 2 eggs and on-the-side (ham, bacon) with fries. My husband got that one and it came out very fast. I got the "Fried chicken steak" which is a steak fried with creamy sauce on top but its soft like chicken breast. The waitress is very nice. She keeps showing up to make sure that we were doing good. Price is reasonable. We'll come back.

Stopped in here for a VERY QUICK bite to eat before we saw the Zombie Burlesque show.  We literally had just 20 minutes.  The bartender was fantastic.  We let her know we had a very short time and she was so fast on getting our food to us.

We had chicken quesadilas and they were very good.  We also got free chips and salsa, too.

The food is really good, I've only had breakfast here. 
Beware there is a fee for using your credit card here which is strange, I haven't come across credit card fees at a major restaurant in a while.

Okay, it's vegas and this is basically a chain.  That said it's a great place to people watch, as they stoll about the Miricle Mile Shops.  We've been here a few times the food is good, although not ground-breaking, as are the margaritas.  if you go off peak hours, esp weekdays, we've typically been able to get a table along the railing.

This is the sixth time that I've been here. I'm here with seven other people from out-of-state and out of country. The food was good, but the chicken and steak fajitas  could have been better.  The service from Carmen T. Was terrible!! She is very friendly when she came to take our orders. After that I could not get her attention to get more water,  to get more sour cream , to get more flour tortillas! I finally got her attention to get more sour cream, but my guest did not needed any  more sour cream because she had finished  eating. At the end of the evening I had to pay $.49 extra for the sour cream and $.29 more to use my credit card!! It is unbelievable how this restaurant have to charge you $.29 to use my credit card!! This restaurant does not know how to be business wise!!  So, there are many restaurants on the same floor as this restaurant I would reconsidered going here.

Ok. So we have been to Vegas a handful of times. And seen this place but have never tried it. It's right next to the V theater. In Miracle Mile Shop. Upon entering we were not greeted. We stood there waiting for about 4 minutes. This is lunch time. Then someone came and  as walking to her podium asked how many. Them seated us. Fine that was prompt. Then when we sat down waitress came by and just asked us you ready to order. I was like ummm....?!?! Hi how are you?!??! Then she asked what would  we like to drink. Didn't tell us about any specials if there was any. By the way we caught her name by name tag. Lizette. Then I asked her what was good here. She gave her re commendation, Fiesta Burrito. But kinda told me from across the table instead of walking by me and helping me find it. She honestly looked and portrayed to us as if she was irritated. Then we told her our  descion. The burrito was huge. 2 people can share. They stuff it with black beans. Ok portion of meat.  Taste was ok. Nothing I would ever come back to again. My son's cheese quesadilla. Not worth  the price. But kid friendly. Got to give that. Margarita salt on rim of cup tasted like a wet rag. Nasty. She dis come a couple times to our table to see if we were okay. Salsa tasted fresh. You can taste the cilantro.  Bathrooms are clean. And they have changing tables. Our bill came out to be 50 bucks for one plate and kids plate and 2 margaritas. It was pkay. In my opinion. Much better places to spend my money foe lunch next time. But the ambiance is prettty cool.

Ehhh the one good thing about this place is their location if you dine outside, people watching through the Miracle Mile.

We came here right after doing dune buggies and we were starved. We were kind of disappointed when we heard they were only serving breakfast, but we dealt. Both ordered the Mexican Scrambled [My friend who is Mexican makes it soooo much better!] but it was satisfying enough.


Now, the drinks. We had come here for drinks a few days before and they were good. But that morning, I ordered a Mimosa and he ordered a Bloody Mary. We shouldnt have expected much coming from a Tex Mex restaurant, but really.. how can you mess up a mimosa?! its only champagne and orange juice... mind you, their orange juice had PULP. Ugh. Ive had plenty of mimosa's and never had pulp in it. Maybe Im wrong, I dont know. And his Bloody Mary was veryyy very ketchupy [Working in the restaurant business, I have made plenty of Bloody Marys and they never tasted like that] But all in all, if you want somewhere to eat thats convenient with decent food, I guess you could go here. But I heard Cabo Wabo is better [wishh we would have went there]

**Went May 31st**

This place was ok, food was quickly made service was alright. I didn't like my burrito much, it made my tummy hurt, I really enjoyed my soda & the nachos could have been MUCH better; I've had better at Denny's. 

I'd skip it next time more than likely.

Nothing great, nothing terrible. The fajitas were oh kay- nothing super tasty or amazing. Price is a bit high, but hey it's Vega$. 

The drinks were not my favorite. Order the $8.50 Patron Margarita for a decent tequila at a good price. However mixing that good tequila with really cheap sweet and sour mix instead of triple sec and lime makes it not so fantastic. 

Maybe a bit cleaner in the restaurant would make it a bit more appealing as well.
When your stuck and the still taste like shit and they charge you for chips and salsa the place sucks balls don't ever eat here Taco Bell would have been way better it was that bad

Excellent. Recommended.
Planet hollywood is the location to go to.
I was afraid to go to La Salsa after bad experience at their strip location. I dared and it was the good food I expect from La Salsa. Superb timely service.

best place on the strip for locals!! 

semi-cheap drinks and good music. do not eat the food here!!! no bueno.

My hubby and I love this restaurant and we come here at least once a yr and we make sure we hit  his place. Good food and awesome prices. However, why do they seat people of color in the very back of the restaurant? Not cool.  Also the hostess should ask the customers if they wish to sit outside or in!

I came here because I was craving mexican food and I was already in Planet Hollywood. This was the closest thing. 

Regular chain mexican food. Not very authentic. Burritos are large portioned and served with a side of rice and beans. I enjoyed it only because my hunger got the best of me. Otherwise, I most likely won't be back.

* I don't know if this is the page for the La Salsa that I went to, since there is another one on Yelp nearby. *

For something on the Strip, expect it to be pricey, of course. However, a sign outside that said "2 FOR 1 CORONAS" caught my eye, so that drew me in. The prices are a bit higher than I would normally pay for Mexican food. However, the food was seemingly a lot better than I had expected. The burrito ranchero I ordered burst with the fillings when I cut into it. I got it with carnitas, which I am glad I did, because the meat was great. In the end, our group ordered three entrees and 4 Coronas for the price of 2, and our bill was just under $60. I guess we got lucky and got the better quality service, because I really can't complain about anything during our visit.

Ok I must first say that we went here because my son in law raved about it.  I wish i would of checked yelp first. (note to self, check yelp first!)

We had a group of 10, they sat us and brought out the drinks and appetizer quickly.  But that's the only positive thing I can say.  The waiter was odd or something!?!  He jumped around the table and took all the guys orders first then went back around and got the girls.  They took their time with the order which would of been fine if they had made everything correctly but two of the plates were made wrong, so my daughter decided to share with my son in law instead of waiting of a remake and the other just eat it as it was made.  The waiter gave my plate to someone else in the party and by time i received a plate and the mistake was noticed half my rice and beans were gone, and the waiter was like well they said it was their plate!!  

besides everything, the food was way below average.  And the two that shared a plate were both up with their heads in the toilet most of the night.  And since we had a large group the useless waiter got a $43.00 tip automatically included in the bill.

There are so many choices on the strip.  Stay clear of this place unless u just go for the happy hour drinks.  But in Vegas everybody's got happy hour...so just stay clear.

The service was fine, the food was just okay. I got fish tacos and it was loaded with cabbage, but overall dry. They charge 49 cents for people who are using a card. This place would be nice for drinks and apps, but I was not impressed.

After spending a lot of money on restaurants and shopping on the Strip, I felt the need to throttle back and went to La Salsa Cantina for their advertised $3.95 breakfast special.  Thanks to a coupon in a publication in my hotel room, it was even cheaper than that!  

I sat "outside", which is outside the restaurant and underneath the fake open sky of the old Aladdin and now the Miracle Mile shopping mall.  It was actually OK.  

The service was fine and so was the breakfast.  Can't go wrong here.

My official favorite breakfast spot in Vegas. We came here every morning for breakfast. For just 4.79 you get 2 eggs cooked however you like it, choice of breakfast meat (sausage, bacon or ham) hash browns and 3 flour tortillas. I order with a side of French toast along with a mimosa, we were good to go. Conveniently located in mall next to Planet Hollywood we work walk over every morning from the Linq. This became our morning ritual during my 5 day stay in Vegas. So delicious. 2 breakfast meals for under 18 dollars you can't go wrong with that. 

Each visit we sat at the bar, service was quick and peaceful. Our server was very helpful and catering to us. I highly recommend this place for breakfast especially after a long night of drinking and gambling.

I ate dinner here last night. I had the taco salad with steak it came with sour cream and guacamole. Within an hour of eating I was sick. I can't pinpoint what it was but my guess would be the sour cream. Today I feel like death. I can't move from bed and have been spending most of my time sick. 

Save your money and go someplace else. The food made me sick, the service was lacking, and the hostesses stood at the hostess station (right behind us) gossiping. It was rude.

This place has the best Mexican food I've ever had hands down.  I've eaten here 3 times and I continue to be impresses with the quality.Now price does not matter to me when looking for a great meal but this place is also so cheap I'm kind of surprise they manage to stay in business, the pricing is excellent!!! If you are looking for a great meal this is the place to be.

My wife and I had breakfast twice at the Miracle Mile location in Las Vegas.
We both ordered the $3.95 breakfast and were happy to find one of the few places that is open for breakfast in the Miracle Mile before 8 AM - it is Vegas Baby.
My wife  ordered the eggs with sausage and I had the ham variation. The sausage was a patty rather than links, which my wife prefers. Included were southwestern style potatoes and choice of corn or flour tortillas. Both breakfasts were adequate and a deal in Vegas. Service was friendly and prompt - at 7:15AM :)

The only reason I am giving it 1 star is because of the service. Food is definitely overpriced at about $20 plate. Drinks are fairly overpriced averaging about $15 a pop (I am factoring in this is La Salsa and not some high end club). Food tasted like flavorless wannabe Mexican food. Don't go there unless you have to. It's not like your traditional La Salsa, it's the red headed step child that no one wants.

So we come here all the time not for the food but drink specials are great considering its the strip. Food is ok chicken enchiladas and fish tacos are good if your hungry... but drinks are great and the Bartenders very nice Brandon is the man. We always have a fun time here! Stop by and meet some loco locals and get a reasonably priced happy hour drink 3pm to 7pm.  Love it!!

I visited during SEMA. The place was quiet and comfortable. The food was good and the portions were huge. 
The drinks were great, they were pricey but they were the best I of the trip.

As a local I was disapointed with this restaurant.  Since I am not yet 21, the hostess told us we could not sit at the tables that were by their bar, which is a reasonable rule for most restaurants; however these tables were no where near the bar. They were closer to the public walking around than they were to the bar.  So they put us at a table in a dark corner (that was next to another bar I might add). So I can't be next to their bar, but it's okay if I'm sitting right next to another one.  
The service and the food was subpar. The waitress had a difficult time understanding us so we had to repeat ourselves a lot. And since the La Salsa Cantina is on the strip it wasn't unexpected that the food was extremely overpriced.  If I was a Vegas tourist and was prepared to overpay a meal,  I would have wanted the food to be of a better quality.
My brother took me on a date here we had a wobbly table and small cups. Plus free beans.

I ate breakfast here a couple of times and the breakfast burrito (and I ordered chorizo with it for an extra $1.50) doesn't disappoint. It's not huge, but filling enough for me not to have food coma afterwards. Equal portions of meat, eggs, etc in the burrito. The waitress who happened to help us was very friendly and took our orders soon after we were seated.

Had the $3.95 breakfast and was very happy with it.  The special runs til noon every day, including weekends.  It's 2 eggs, breakfast potatoes, 2 warm tortillas and your choice of breakfast meat. Kind of hard to beat.  They also have $1 small bloody mary's before noon.  Our server was slow but he did have a lot of tables.  Our food took longer than the table beside us, even though we'd ordered a good 5-10 minutes before them...but I can't complain about the food portion size, which was generous, and the very cheap price.  It was a tasty, standard breakfast, and I'd recommend it for those traveling through. 

 I can't speak to the lunch or dinner items though...
Decent food with lots of vegeterian options but pricey as with most vegas restaurants.

Avoid this place like the plague it's double the price of a regular La Salsa ( they even charge you for chips and salsa really seriously). The waitress barely spoke English and you could hardly understand her. She took the order then she was MIA she never came to check on us. To the extent that we had to get another server to refill our drinks and get the bill. LaSalsa you should be ashamed to be employing such a low caliber of employee!!!
Went here for my honeymoon and the food was great and service what wonderful!! Will be back :)

Service sucks.  Margaritas that are hand made, you have to ask and upgrade the booze, are good. Food mediocre, at best.  Tourist trap. 

There is no attention to detail. 

There are hundreds of Mexican owned restaurants in town that are considerably better. 

Save your money!

While the food was about average for Mexican food, the service was exceptional!  My lovely wife and I went for breakfast because they have some good deals.  We didn't get their $4.79 special but opted for some omelets at $9.  I also had a .99 Bloody Mary which came in a Dixie cup but was quite tasty.  Not sure why, but many of the Bloody Mary's on the Strip are super spicy.  When I've made them I use good tomato juice, a touch of clam juice, a bit of lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce and a dash or two of Tabasco.  They're flavorful with just a touch of heat.

Anyway, they rest of our party showed up a bit later (total of 4 adults and two kids) and there was no problem from anyone for the wait or setting up the extra table.  She also was prompt with the other's orders and handled things great!

Recommended for a morning breakfast.
The breakfast special is only $4.29 until noon. Two eggs potatoes meat tortillas.  Service in under three minutes.  Loved it coffee and margaritas until new $.99

Their breakfast specials are killer!!!!! What a steal for great portions and good quality food! I'm craving La Salsa right now! First thing I did after having La Salsa for the first time was look into their locations to see if there were any near me back home. It is definitely worth giving them a try. They blow breakfast out of the water.
Really great decent meal for breakfast and amazing .99 Bloody Mary. Not sure why bad reviews. Good food at great price.
Great place to go to if you want mexican food in vegas! Staff is friendly and the food is good. Try to get their before 11 am for their breakfast special. Their breakfast is really good!

I love Mexican food but customer service is horrible so I tend to avoid it now. I hate being ignored especially when you only have a few minutes to eat. The staff is plain rude, we went to Blondie's accross the street, service was still slow but the waitresses are quite friendly.

If you are a La Salsa fan you'll be disappointed. Nothing to do with the real La Salsa although they don the La Salsa Logo. NO SALSA BAR to start and nothing on the menu resembling the usual greatness. Food was OK at best but nothing like the real deal. Not coming back

Tourist trap. Nice to watch people walk by, but paying for chips and salsa at a Mexican restaurant is sac relig. Weak drinks and the waitress was just a hustler. We saw her 3x in an hour. Food was ok, but nothing to write home about. And they can only run 4 credit cards per table.

Came here after shopping because me and my friends we're starving! The food was alright and it was kinda weird how they charged extra for chips and salsa because usually restuarants give that stuff for free. The waiters were pretty nice me and my friends were pretty loud and some were buzzed! Cute place but the food is just average.

Unremarkable but fully satisfactory burrito in the PH mall area, across from Blondies Sports Bar. Well-priced for the Strip, around $12-$14 for the thing.  Had Dos Equis Lager on tap. Did the job, didn't break the bank, good attentive service, couple of TVs...
Great cheap breakfast, I really enjoyed the $3.99 breakfast special (eggs, breakfast potatoes, bacon, and tortillas). The $0.99 bloody mary is tiny though.

Worst Mexican food we have ever eaten. My husband ordered the seafood burrito plate and I had a cheese enchilada and chicken taco (soft taco because they don't have crispy). The food was dry and had no flavor. Chips and salsa are extra. The margaritas were weak. Definitely not worth the expensive price.

They don't exactly have the best Mexican food around, but the Mexican pizza with steak is pretty good. Also, they have a decent queso that they serve with tortilla chips and soft flour tortillas. But my favorite item on their menu is the taquitos. 

The service is hit or miss but they are always friendly.

Food was good, service very nice, or waitress was attentive and on point with water refills and very friendly.  4.79 breakfast was quick and pretty nice size portion. Ther only reason for the 3 stars is my husband's under cooked over medium eggs, that are a bit runny

Great breakfast for a very cheap price!!! And a good spicy bloody mary!!! We were served very quickly. We ordered the $3.75 breakfast special, which was a pretty well sized portion. Definitely have and will be recommending this place to many others!

An absolutely terrible restaurant. It started when we arrived and had to search for an employee to be seated. We should have left at that point. Instead we were seated and waited another 15 minutes before someone came over to take our order. We ordered everything at once not knowing when we would see them again. They never brought us water, even after asking for it. I personally think water should always be brought automatically at all restaurants, but I know some places run things differently. The food came quickly enough after that, but it was AWFUL. Dry and tasteless, I had to dump Cholula all over it to give it any flavor. 

Had to wait about 20 minutes after we finished eating to get our check. The table next to us was trying to pay their bill for that entire time and the waiter never came back to their table to get it. I think they just wound up leaving. 

And finally the real kicker, they brought our check and the total was $59.92. We paid with a credit card and the slip to sign was for $60.21. Not a large difference, but a completely different number, not a "fat finger" typo. Do they mark up every check for another few cents as a scam? Not sure but it screamed red flag to me. I would never go back here and highly recommend everyone stay away.
I work inside the mall and I love how they have there own menu for the employees that work in the mall!! Awesome and the verde enchiladas are my fav.

Went for breakfast for the 99cent bloody Mary's. they are small but a buck you can't complain. Got the hevous rancheros & they were excellent! Nice portion & very filling. Potatoes were nicely seasoned, beans were just typical beans. If you are looking for a good quick breakfast on the strip check em out.

This restaurant is located within the Miracle Mile mall on the strip. They have great drink specials and prices are far more reasonable than other places in the area. Food was served quickly and the menu selection was excellent. I easily put together a filling vegan meal. That being said, there was nothing to distinguish it from other Mexican places, but it's a good safe option which would please even the pickiest eater.
Food was so-so, service was just horrible and slow. Took about 15 minutes to order, another 45 to get the food! When we were seated, there were only 2 other tables with customers, so not busy at all.
Amazing!! Favorite place to eat after a hangover! The bartenders are absolutely amazing!

In addition to eating at the other location, we also visited this location twice in early September.  We only had drinks and snacks here in the evening.  I had margaritas, made w/ patron for $7.99.  They were very good drinks.  We had chips and salsa w/ them.  They were good and not too pricy.  They were bottomless so they just hit the spot w/ our drinks.  We had the same server twice.  He was a very nice guy.  I checked out the menu and want to have dinner here sometime.  I had breakfast at the other location and it was great.

We stopped here for breakfast after picking up some tickets at the box office for Planet Hollywood. We found the food to be very tasty and the waiter managed to accommodate my special request order. I would definitely stop there again if I was in the area.

This used to be our go-to for yardstick-length margaritas because they sold them for much cheaper than everyone else - BUT NOT ANYMORE! We pretty much paid for double this last time. I even got double shots, and didn't taste anything in mine, while my husband's was pretty strong (I think that happened last time too). It was making me sick and I ended up tossing mine. Ugh, never again!

Walking around the Miracle Mile Mall the night before, we saw signs for a $4.79 breakfast special.  Seemed to run like many of the breakfast places around.  We made a point to check it out in the morning.
We went over there and were quickly seated in a booth.  Menus and water were dropped off.  I opted for the special.  Two eggs, potatoes, choice of meat, and tortilla.  To sum it up, it was fine.  Obviously, it wasn't anything special.  It was as advertised.  Cheap and fine breakfast.  If you are by the place in the morning, you can do worse.  Nothing was special about the place.  Decor was meh.  Server was nice enough, but he wasn't the most attentive.  I would go again.

We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food here. Since it's in the Miracle Mile shops, which is a mall, we weren't expecting much at all but it was conveniently located so we went for it. I got the Chicken & Avacado Enchilada which was actually two flat corn tortillas with grilled chicken and sliced Avacado and cheese in between but it's topped with shredded cabbage, cilantro, and sour cream, and also your choice of red or Verde sauce. I chose the Verde. Delicious dish, came with a side of rice and perfectly sauted vegetables. Spouse got a massive pork burrito that was also delicious, good flavor. All around good meal because the service was prompt and friendly. Definitely go here again.
A cold beer and tasty tacos at a reasonable price. The owner/manager was helpful and checked on us several times. For the money, one of the best meals I had on the trip.

"FML"

Going here makes me want to thank my parents everyday that they didn't raise me to be white trash.  Located in a mall populated with a mix of the cast of the Jersey shore, COPS, Real Housewives, and State Fairs, this restaurant will primarily appear to you if you like have never been to a Mexican restaurant other than Chipotle.     Our server was nice, but looked like she might have contracted 3 STDs before she was 18.

The bigs: 
- The was average, even edible.  I had the baja style fresh grilled fish tacos and munched on some of the steak fajitas.  A little bland for me, but it seemed that it was prepared in the recent present and the sides were tasty.  Obviously nothing close to authentic.

The diggs:
-One of the worst frozen margaritas I have ever had.  It was a sweetened icy slush of artificial nothingness.  Even though it was Happy Hour cheap at $3, skip it.

- They have the 48oz mini-Yard style Margaritas.  Cheap, large drinks seems to be the attraction here.  Perhaps consuming them would help to tolerate the other customers and this mall.

Like everything in this gigantic mall, it is artificial, cheesy and just plain wrong.  Sigh, this party of Vegas sours the whole experience for me.  When do I fly back to NYC again?

We came here solely for their 3.95 breakfast special - needed a quick, convenient meal before hitting the road haha.  In terms of their breakfast special, it definitely does the job. You get 2 eggs, any way, some potatoes, a choice of meat, and 2 tortillas.  Nothing fancy, but it was a pretty straightforward, filling breakfast, not much to complain about. For a little extra kick, you can also get .99 bloody marys - yeah, small in size, but only 0.99, so what do you expect?  I'd say a pretty solid breakfast special that I'd come back for if I'm simply looking for something cheap, filling, and convenient.  Also, their breakfast special lasts until noon!  Which is pretty late for usual breakfast specials (but admittedly pretty early to be awake on the strip ;)

As far as cheap breakfast goes, this is where you need to be in Vegas! $3.95 for 2 eggs, choice of: ham, bacon, or sausage, potatoes with peppers and onions, and choice of: flour or corn tortillas. Add a coffee or bloody Mary for 99 cents! Total bill was $5.26. And I got to make my own breakfast tacos! Wish I had another day here to come for breakfast tomorrow. 

Nice tequila selection if you're into that too. They have all kinds of specials and deals all day.

To get there: (we couldn't find it yesterday) go into the miracle mile shops near planet hollywood (just past Paris), go all the way to the back of the mall. Across from Blondie ' sports bar. Which looks pretty cool as well. They also have a $2.99 breakfast special, but I'm a sucker for Mexican! But I'm sure I'll be checking that place out later in the day. Stop in and enjoy some cheap, delicious, Vegas breakfast!

We had tickets for 7p show at theV theater and wanted to be near by and found this place right next to the theater. Service was quick and large serving. Ordered the appetizer sampler and a burrito, enjoyed a few drinks since it was happy hour. Would come back..

48 ounces of margarita bliss! I'll say it again: FORTY-EIGHT. Yeah! You have to carry around this dorky glass though, but about halfway thru it, you realy don't care who stares at you. 

It's $24, but when you think about it, most margaritas cost about $8 for 8 ounces.... So you're actually SAVING money by buying in bulk. 

Chips were fine, salsa was fine, guac was fine. Service was fine. Booze was awesome. Lots of tequila selection, and if you ask really nicely, you might get to sample some of the different kinds. Look for the bartender with the big earrings. She'll hook you up.

Great spot to get breakfast! Only $4.79 for two eggs however you want, bacon/sausage, breakfast potatoes & tortillas (soft or corn)! It was a great deal and really good food. 99 Cents!! For Bloody Mary or mimosa. Can upgrade to a pint for only $2. The staff was great and didn't take long for the food at all. A very cool spot, like old Vegas, to get good food & good service for a good price.

Stopped here for dinner at about 1800. Took a long while for the busy bartender to get to me and neglect to give me chips. My hunger subsided a bit so I just ordered a chicken quesadilla and received a cheese one instead. The order was made right but the food was bland and uneventful. Chicken seemed unseasoned. At least the beer was cold. Won't be back.
The sampler and happy hour drinks are great not the usual watered down happy hour drinks. Service is great and ambiance well it's Vegas !!!

This place served extremely strong margaritas and decent food but the service was HORRIBLE!  Our server was nice but completely remiss in attending to our needs.  Two of my friends sent their food back to be rewarmed and it took forever for us to eat despite having been ready to place our orders almost immediately.  Don't go unless you have a lot of time to wait around as they seem completely disorganized.

Always wanted to try the 3.95 breakfast.  It was indeed cheap and filling.  The potatoes were actually surprisingly good with onions and peppers mixed in.  My daughter had some unimpressive french toast, which at six, she actually enjoyed and devoured.  

Good for a cheap breakfast if in the area.  Friendly service.

If you need your Mexican fix, this will work. But don't expect the best Mexican food in Vegas.  The convenience was there due to being close to my hotel. The service was top notch! The happy hour margaritas were a deal @ $3.50 from 3-7pm. The chips/salsa they charge for but they were good. With all the awesome places you might want to try something else. Unless you just need that Mexican food fix. The price wasn't that bad either. Close and convenience won out on this visit. Thanks for the great customer service and of course the porch (view and people watching) were perfect!

Service: They really need to up their game. If we have to wait 10 mins to get some salsa, you know there's something wrong.
Food: Unimpressive

Food quality and service simply does not justify the price.

$3.99 for breakfast. What can go wrong? Even if it is bad, you will not spend more than you will at McDonald anyway.

The breakfast includes 2 eggs with the style of your choice, sausage or ham, corn or flour tortilla and southern style potatoes. Nothing fancy about it but is decent. I am glad it is not a fake deal just to lure you in but a real thing. 

The restaurant is clean and service is good.

meh. I've experienced better. 

My annual trip to Vegas always includes 8:01 am trips to La Salsa for their breakfast. And by breakfast, I mean 99 cent bloody mary's. And by 99 cent bloody mary's, I mean cups of ice and vodka and watery bloody mary mix that keeps me going for another few hours before passing out around noon after the The food is nothing fantastic, but let's be serious when I am still awake at 8 am, (and by awake, I mean wastedface) I am not in the mood for 5 star dining! All I need is hot food, zero waiting time, and 99 cent bloody mary's. For the breakfast prices, the food is definitely not bad. Most of it is pretty decent, just bland. The mary's are also very bland, it's more like tomato juice and vodka. But, there is enough vodka to satisfy me, and plenty of cholula on the table to make it tasty!

Like I said, price-wise, breakfast is awesome. Under 7 bucks for just about everything, and good portions. Lunch and dinner are definitely more expensive, but not bad compared to other strip restaurants. If you're staying at Planet Hollywood, or are in the Miracle Mile shops, come here for a good breakfast deal. If you are not in the vicinity.. go somewhere else. 

But, all this being said..  I come here just about every day, on every vegas trip. :)

If you are looking for a pseudo-Mexican place, this is the one. I live in California and expect two things at any authentic Mexican restaurant: 1) Free chips and salsa, and 2) A good home made salsa. They have neither. They charge for chips and when I asked for that special salsa, they offered Cholula, come on, a Mexican place without home made salsa? They should change their marketing and stop deceiving patrons!

I got sick from their food.
I should have read their yelp reviews before deciding to have lunch here.

My girlfriend got the fish tacos and asked for no cheese (lactose intolerant). They brought the dish out with cheese. So we apologized and let them know that she is is allergic to cheese and needed the dish to be remade. The server said, "ok, we'll make a new dish"

A few minutes later, they brought the dish out. It had one sliver of cheese on it and messy sauce on top. They had just removed the cheese instead of making a new dish!!

So we notified the manager. If she just didn't like cheese or couldn't have it for a silly reason, we would have let it pass. But, she cannot have the slightest bit of dairy... so we took it seriously. 

I don't recommmend this place. Go get an Auntie Anne's pretzel instead :)

The food is absolutely disgusting! Extremely salty and horrible service. I took 2 bites of my food and told them I didn't want it. They didn't even offer if I wanted anything else or if the food was okay. I still had to pay, which was kinda disappointing since I barely even touched it. I ate there for lunch, but I hear their breakfast is good. Anyways, I will definitely never eat at this restaurant again. I am highly disappointed with the service and quality of the food.

La Salsa Cantina is buried in the back of the Planet Hollywood's Miracle Mile Shops, but they have great breakfast specials before noon--$3.99 for 2 eggs, potatoes, choice of meat and 2 tortillas and $0.99 bloody marys. The food is simple, but hearty, and the bloody mary is fine (it is only 8 ounces, but for this prices you can get a few).

We were able to get a seat in the open area at the front of the restaurant, which offers good views of the people passing by, the sport's bar across the walkway, and the small fountain that is choreographed to music. The atmosphere is loud...since you are right by the walkway, but it is very good people watching.

Our service was fine--very quick for as busy as they were and, when asked about a spicy bloody, he brought us extra hot sauce.

I wish I would have discovered this place earlier in my visit to Las Vegas...a great place to start the day and save some cash.

After walking out of another restaurant in Miracle Mile, we went here and we're seated and had our drinks within 5 minutes.  Hurray for good service.  My shrimp tacos were good but some of the edges of the tortillas were sort of dry and hard like they were stale. That's why I didn't give 5 stars.

My coworkers really wanted Mexican food, or I never would have stepped foot in this place.

It's hard to find, jammed in a back corner of Caesars, by the Uber pickup area. It's only got about six tables, and four waitstaff. You would think with that ratio we would get good service, but for some reason, they would vaporize as soon as you needed them. We had to ask for our check four times before someone actually brought it. Between food drop off and asking for the check, we saw the waiter once, behind the bar.

The margarita was tasty (hence the 2 stars), but there was barely any alcohol in it. The nachos were decent, but the whole experience was just really "meh". And in Las Vegas, you cannot be meh.

Here is why La Salsa Cantina should be your breakfast destination:

CHEAP. $5 eggs, potato, meat, tortilla deal. $5!!!! full plate!!!! Tastes great!  Not the absolute best in the world, but absolutely terrific for what it is.

Breakfast cocktails. YAS. I had baileys in coffee--$5. That brings my delicious, boozy breakfast for a total of $10.

I have been to Vegas many times, and I have been to La Salsa Cantina a handful of times. If it is a close enough walk for you, I would say DO IT. DO IT NOW.

We were starving so we just headed into La Salsa. It was pretty good. I got the Mexican Pizza appetizer with shrimp. The pizza was pretty big for an appetizer too. The shrimp wasn't that good. The service was friendly and fast. We ordered 4 shots of patron, they brought us something else that tasted like Jose Cuevo. Probably wouldn't come back to a La Salsa in Vegas.
It was a good option for what we're were after ... We shared the guacamole and tacos. Just an okay option - wouldn't rush to go there. Sport is on the big screen which was husband was happy about.

This establishment is located in the Miracle Mile of Shops at Planet Hollywood.  Service was alright, food was ok, pricing was horrible.  I had the Mexican scramble which consisted of diced potatoes, tortillas and a very small amount of chorizo con egg.  When I say small amount-small amount for a couple of mouthfuls for $8 plus worth of food.  I really hate being taken advantage of on portion-pricing.  We will not make any more stops at this particular La Salsa.....

The chilaquiles were amazing, the eggs cooked perfectly. Sometimes beans are hit or miss but the beans we were served had a good flavor. We made it just on time beating the breakfast rush. Not much else to say, I'll be thinking about those dang chilaquiles until we visit again!

Quick service and average prices for drinks.  $9 for a shot of henny isn't great, but according to Vegas prices, they're not bad.

Added star for the cool video gambling at the bar area.

This - like most things I found on the Vegas strip - was watered down, fake, and overpriced.
