There was a supposed happy hour. What's that you say? You'd like a margarita? You'd like a happy hour margarita? Oh you can only have that if it's frozen. 

Wait, what? I can only get a 'happy hour' priced margarita if it's frozen, if I get the exact same drink on the rocks it's $6 extra? Wtf. Just so you can cheat me out of alcohol? Lame. 

The drinks were horrible, watered down, and not worth any money really. The food was bland. We had to pay of course for salsa and chips. 

Our server was nice but not necessarily attentive.

All in all though - what can you really expect from a chain mexican restaurant in ceasars palace? I should have known what we were getting into.

I love this place!!! Anytime and every time I'm in Vegas, a stop here is a MUST!!! BEST MARGARITA ON THE STRIP!!! With an extra shot for $1!!! Brandon is my favorite bartender by far!!! Will even entertain my inappropriate polls... hahha... food here is great!!! Love the chilaquiles if I'm up early enough to catch breakfast!!! Otherwise I get the taquitos or a burrito!!! Can't go wrong on the menu!!! Luckily I don't live in Vegas, I'd be here EVERYDAY!!!

Food was cold. Rice was in cooked. Davis came in wrong shell. Supposed to be corn but came in flour. Tortillas were hard. After asking for corn tortilla they brought some that young could tell were just in microwave. Only good thing about restaurant was the chips and salsa, which was $2.95. And the manager was nice. He comped our meal.

I have eaten here on past Vegas trips and remembered them being a little better than what we got today. 

We got there about 10 minutes before their "Happy Hour" started. They told us about it and assumed since it was just a mere 10 min away, they'd honor it. My husband ordered a happy hour drink and before the server left I was like- that's the special price right? She goes no- that starts at 3. We said, then we'll wait the 10 minutes and then put in our drink order. We ended up getting a margarita for $3 and a beer for $2. Margarita was tasty. 

We started off with some chips and salsa.
Not a fan of having to pay for these. I'm used to free chips and salsa at Mexican joints. My meal wasn't too bad- I got the fajita quesadilla. It was good. My husband ordered a burrito but had to be specific about no cheese or sour cream, no guac, no salsa. Basically it was supposed to be rice, beans and chicken. Unfortunately, he got about 1/2 way through it and started gagging on chunks of tomato. He almost threw up on his plate. He was so nauseated he couldn't finish the meal but didn't want me to send it back or complain about it. (Sigh). 

Over priced just average Mexican. I doubt we'd return.

Not only is this place ridiculously overpriced for the campy Miracle Mile, but it's thoroughly mediocre. I ordered a carnitas burrito which tasted like steamed chicken and tomato paste. The tortilla had the consistency of moist clay...very unappetizing for the price. 

Adding insult to injury, three waiters kept pressuring me with questions the entire time; "Would you like another drink, sir?" "Isn't there anything else we can get for you, sir?" Their cloying attitude made me feel like I was at a strip mall theme restaurant, but what else can one expect with a description like "Mexican fare." Indeed, that's exactly what you'll get here: far below "cuisine" and just short of "food."
The food was decent. Service was decent. Cockroaches were an extra. Disgusting. Never again!
Good Mexican place in the Planet Hollywood shops.  Food was quite good.   It was a bit odd that they charged extra for some more salsa.  Would eat at again.
Came to have breakfast... The waitress was very nice and attentive. I got the chilequiles they were a little salty and the beans were horrible but overall good experience.

We came for breakfast. Understaffed, which left much to be desired in terms if service- but we were warned upon entry that they were behind. Great food but one plate came out warm not hot. Great chilaquiles and Mexican scramble despite temp. Amazing breakfast drinks: boozy coffee and Hot Tamale Maria. Would come back for breakfast if we had plenty of time to spare. One last addition, they had a great photographer coming around offering a "free" photo. Ours turned out great, so we got a free thumb-size and purchased a 4x6 for $20.

I went for the breakfast special and, for the price, you can't go wrong. Plus, their margaritas are VERY good! Everyone in my table ordered standard breakfast items, so nothing special to review, but everything was cooked well and tasted good. Again, don't expect a gastronomic meal if you're paying $5-10... that's not what this place is for.

Well, it's safe to say that the majority of the reviewers were right when they said this is NOT authentic Mexican food. I usually like to see things for myself, and since we got a deal on dinner and a show we chose this place and the Vegas show (which is a must-see!). Anyway, we made a reservation because we were going to come in during the dinner rush (6:45), I figured they'd be packed and it'd be plenty of time to make our 9:00 show. We got there around 6:45-6:50 and the place barely had anyone in it so we were seated quickly. Once we told them we had the deal the waitress quickly snatched our menus and gave us a limited menu. What I wanted was on there anyway, but I didn't appreciate that she snatched our menus like that. Our food came out pretty quickly but my food was not smoking hot, but the plate was which was a little odd. I ordered the chicken enchiladas and my fiancé ordered the grande steak burrito. No chips came with our meal, 1st issue. #2. My food was not hot. #3. We've made homemade enchiladas before and they clearly used the La Preferida red enchilada sauce from the can. Major disappointment. Why the hell would I come out and pay for food that you pulled out of a can? Anyway, my chicken was good, but the enchiladas also needed more cheese. I was so excited to come here because it looked good and exciting because of the yard long glass on their sign... Oh well, they got me in there once, but you can bet I won't be back.

The breakfast for 4.79 is a great deal, though add some coffee and a tip and you're quickly dropping ten or more bucks. I loved the corn tortilla option. 
Seating may be a wait unless you're willing to sit at the bar. 
Lots of good drinks.
Good service. 
Good food.

The service...ahh...the service.  Or lack thereof.

With competition for diners and customers stiff, this place amazingly manages to pull people in thinking that they're going to get a dining deal until they realize (after they've paid the bill) that they've been shafted.

I just remember going in and ordering an appetizer in hopes of having a quick lunch only to leave late for my next meeting because we saw our server once every 15-20 minutes.  The food wasn't even that great - I could get better nachos in a 7-Eleven.  Not coming back - plenty of other places to eat that I could get better food and service at.

I would not go here if you're looking for some delicious and authentic Mexican food because you won't find it here. 
The food was decent but overpriced (but hey it's Vegas). I got the sampler appetizer plate to share with a friend which basically had all the appetizers they offer on it. It wasn't that great. 
My other friend got the chips and guacamole...worst I've ever had at a restaurant which was shocking since they bragged about it so much on the menu. Don't care to ever go back.

Wanted Mexican food and have eaten at the one in Planet Hollywood and loved it.  This one was not as good as the one in PH, but it was good.  We ordered chips and salsa for the table, which came with 4 different salsas.  I liked the mild and hot red salsas the best.  The food everyone got was great.  Service was quick, ambiance was a little boring inside where we ate.

Went to La Salsa Cantina for dinner.  For people watching it is a great location if you are lucky enough to get an outside location.  The food and service were average at best and the beer selection was extremely limited.  This is the first Mexican Restaurant that I have been to that doesn't offer ground beef as a meat choice.  The portions were adequate but I felt like I was at Taco Bell with table service.  We decided to try their $4.79 breakfast.  We were thrilled with both the food and the service.  The eggs were cooked perfectly.  The generous and crisp bacon were amazing.  The potatoes were crispy and well seasoned.  Either Wheat or Corn Tortillas were also included.  Although I wouldn't recommend dinner, breakfast was awesome!

As a local finding good happy hours on the strip is always a mission. I'm never opposed to trying something new on the strip, and while on a "staycation" trying La Salsa's Happy Hour at Planet Hollywood seemed like a great idea, a 16oz Margarita on the rocks for $3.50 on the strip, hells yes! Well once my boyfriend and I were 3 drinks in, and I ran to the restroom while he ordered the 4th round with another 10 minutes until Happy Hour ended, we waited 42 minutes to not only to never receive the round but to be rung up. Customer service fail, I am most definitely not the person that you want to stop bringing rounds to, especially when I would not have cared to even pay full price well past Happy Hour. Not acknowledging a paying customer let alone a local, Epic fail, especially when I manage a business on Las Vegas Blvd. Where does the service mentality go these days?!
I ordered the Pork Carnitas Fajitas and it was really good! I was so hungry after JLo's concert, I forgot to snap a photo of it.

Located in the Miracle Mile shops at Planet Hollywood, La Salsa gets your attention with its neon pink sign and Yard Stick drinks.

La Salsa has breakfast special from 8am-11am. We stopped by to grab a quick bite before heading back to the airport. Although the food isn't something you'd rush over here for, the parents and I had decent breakfast of eggs, ham, sausage, potatoes (too salty!) and tortilla for CHEAP. 

Like, $3.95 breakfast special cheap.

Can you find a better deal in Vegas? on the strip?

Didn't think so.

Stopping at this place for quick and cheap frozen margaritas was exactly what we needed after walking around for a few hours in the desert heat. 

We only stopped in because we got a card for 2 for 1 frozen drinks during happy hour. I can't complain - the outdoor bar had mist spraying each of the chairs at the bar and 2 margaritas were $10 - you can't beat that in Vegas!

Was out with a party of four looking to kill an hour before a show at the nearby V Theater. This place fit the bill. We just wanted drinks and appetizers and that's what we got.

The decor in this place is kinda weird. Holes in the drywall, chairs and tables splattered with paint, not exactly the look of a Mexican cantina unless you want it to look like it's under construction.

Service was good. We were seated right away. The hostess, waiter, and 100 year old busboy were friendly and helped add to the atmosphere. 

My wife and I split a couple pitchers of Dos Equis they had on special for 12.95. Our guests had a couple top shelf margaritas that they said were "top shelf" and the prices were good compared to other Mexican cantinas in Vegas. We also split a Cantina sampler that was a mixed bag. It was nachos, quesadillas, taquitos and chicken wings. The wings were small but had good flavor. The quesedillas were tasty (my wife and I devoured them), and the taquitos weren't bad, similar to what I've had at Chili's. The nachos? um, no. These tasted as if they were served earlier in the evening, sat out on someone else's table for an hour or so, brought back to the kitchen and microwaved before serving to us. Seriously, these were bad. Some of the nachos were soggy and cold, others were still warm but dried out. 

When we got the check we noticed they charged for chips and salsa. Really? Before we could sit down we were asked if we wanted chips and salsa on the table. Ok. sure. Would you also like guacamole? sure. When we killed the bowl of chips they asked if we wanted more. Sure!  So we got charged for 2 orders of chips and salsa plus guacamole. I can understand the guacamole, apparently it is a standard upcharge in Vegas cantinas but chips and salsa? Everywhere else we have tried, they have been free. Some places just seem desperate to make a buck.

The bathroom needed to be cleaned and I noticed several dirty tables toward the back of the restaurant that no one bothered to clear off while we were there. I am guessing the 100 year old busboy was still making his way there. That did not help add to the atmosphere.

Would I stop here again? Yes. I would avoid the nachos though.
Gave it 1 star cause i couldnt do 0. Fajitas was tiny and the steak tasted like liver. Was good years ago. Terrible now

Stopped by here to grab a quick bite before a show.  We ordered chicken tacos, mexican pizza and chips and salsa.  For drinks we had pina colada and a pomegranate margarita.  First of all the service was fantastic!!  Our waitress was helpful, promt and very friendly.  The food was delicious and the pomegranate margarita was possibly the best I've ever had.  So glad I stopped by and will do so again next time I'm in the area.

Came here over a glorious hot summer day. Drinks were great. I got the giant margarita. It was totally worth it at this place since a heavy hand is always great. Conversation was a blast too. Hung out with Louis and chatted for about 10 minutes before we made our way back to the strip. Definitely recommend swinging by this place if you want a quick drink.

Excellent location and a good happy hour, but the service was absolutely horrible.  The food was also poor quality but in all fairness I am comparing it to Phoenix standards which is pretty good.  I had a burrito, and to compensate for the lack of taste they decided to overloaded it with sour cream and cheese.  The kids meals looked decent, but be careful because the chicken tenders included two and it was weak.  The prices were good for Vegas standards, so the rating is based on location and value... certainly not taste!

We were staying in Planet Hollywood and needed and place to brunch. All the drinks were good and all the food was good. My parents were happy with their meals but not impressed. We are from Texas so Jalisco and Tex Mex food is way better here. My meal however was awesome!! I got the Huevos Rancheros (I think) and it kind of blew my socks off. Not sure if it was the salsa on the eggs or what but it was some of the best brunch I've had. I'd go back.
Was not expecting Mexican food to be this good in vegas! I will definitely eat hear the next time where in town.
lovely nice and sheap , the have a very fast service .ask for Maria ( Server)she is very sweet and nice .. btw speaks english and spanish)

Since its located in the Miracle Mile mall and we stayed at the Elara which is connected the the mall we ate here a few times for breakfast since it was good and cheap. Breakfast special has 2 eggs any way, a meat (bacon, sausage, etc) hashed potatoes, and tortilas. The get you with the drink prices though. $3 for a juice. Huband had the steak burrito one morning and he said it was very good to. Waitstaff isn't always helpful or friendly, but some of them were.

Blech. Similar to some of my other Vegas reviews, this place will unfortunately be subject to scrutiny over the one thing I ordered from it. My friends and I all got the $20 giant margaritas (which are about 17" tall, for those curious), and we all regretted it. Extremely heavy on the syrup and not heavy at all on the liquor. No one finished their drink, and we all stopped taking gulps of grossly sour slush at about the same point in our enormous souvenir cups. And the sad thing was, we weren't even buzzed in the slightest to show for it. So even though you see folks strutting around with their huge margaritas...your money is better spent elsewhere =).

Came here with my besties during my bachelorette weekend! Solid food and better yet... amazing margaritas on the rocks and $3 Coronas on a holiday weekend! Fajitas were on point as was the gaucamole, veggie burrito and shrimp tacos. Yum. Victor was the best

Out celebrating our friends 1 year wedding anniversary, I wanted a margarita. After checking out a few places we settled on this place. We stood forever at the hostess stand waiting to be seated. Finally a girl came over and took us to a table and gave us menus. Priced at $12.50 (regularly priced $17.50 when not on special) I ordered a strawberry "Margarita-by-the-Yard" and I couldn't taste any alcohol at all. Our friends couldn't taste any in theirs either, so we asked our server when she finally came back around if we could buy some shots to add to it. She said they are $1 per shot so I ordered 2 shots to add to mine. The margarita seemed like it was mostly ice and I just didn't care for it.

I figured with salsa being in the name of this place that we would get the standard complimentary chips and salsa, but nope! Chips and salsa cost here! I decided to just order a "Mexican Pizza" priced at $7.95 to munch on. It was a flour tortilla that had a crunch to it with pinto beans, cheese, salsa and sour cream. The beans weren't very warm and tasted bland. Honestly the fresh avocado was the only good part about it. Maybe if their margaritas actually gave people a buzz the food would taste better! 

Our server wasn't great about checking on us and slow with bringing out our drinks and food. She carded us when we ordered the drinks, but then carded our friend 2 more times and he didn't even order but one drink that he was already carded for. She seemed a bit spacey. I didn't mind the prices at all, but wasn't satisfied with my drink, food or the service we recieved. I can

After arriving in Vegas and starving we stopped at the first restaurant that looked decent. It was perfect for a quick lunch. The drinks were awesome and the fish tacos were light and seasoned really well. The salsa appetizer is a great start! Also, great service.

Great service!  Our waitress was always near and stopped at all the right times. The $3 margaritas were also great and several. The nachos were tasty, I've had better. The same goes for the fish tacos.  Those two dishes more than slated our hunger and in fact some of each was still on our plate when we finished. We'll  be back.
Good service. Perfect setting. Perfect location. Excellent food. Make this a pit stop off the strip for good food and great cold soda and beer on a hot day $3.95 breakfasts here until noon!

Kids wanted Mexican......sooooo glad we got a discount offer for this place. I would've been UPSET if I had to pay full price for their "mexican food."  I know it's a chain, but it wasn't good at all.....  Service SUCKED!  Had to wait to be seated.......wait to get drinks ordered........wait to get food ordered.  Our server was MIA, someone else took our order & brough it out to us.  Other staff got our drinks....our server only checked on us once or twice.  We were starving.....ate what we could and left!  Never will we go back!! Sooooo many better places to try.....stay away!!
The food was very good with big portion sizes for the price. The atmosphere was also fun because we sat near the fountain and got to see the show while we ate.

We found on yelp and wanted to try this place. $4.99 breakfast but we did not make it for breakfast. Ended up being lunch and $55 bucks later plus $4 tip was way too much. They charge you for everything so be aware and service was not great forgot to check on us and sever did not hear me when I asked for 2 meals the same for me and my husband. Server Jesus only brought out one meal. Did not refill our drinks, kids meal does not include beverages so you pay$ 2.25 for kids drink plus the meal, chips and Salas are $2.25 and he did not even refill them we had to ask for service many times, to top it off we paid and they charged and extra .29 cents to use my card. This place is way over rated and my enchiladas we not even that good.

Food was ok. Got seafood burrito. Won't get it again. Missing something. Was dry. Tomato onion and cilantro would make it 100 percent better.  Or even run of the mill salsa but you have to buy salsa and chips.  A little guacamole was lumped in the center. Might have had sour cream but couldn't tell. Had a little (very little) lettuce. Lots of rice in the burrito added to the dryness. Could have lived without it.

Middle of the pack food with inflated prices thanks to its location. The margaritas tasted great but left us to ordering if they forgot to add the Tequila. I'd suggest sticking to the appetizers since they're more than big enough as a meal and relatively reasonably priced.
Favorite Mexican food restaurant on the strip. Great service, great prices!! Try the chicken nachos :)

This is possibly the worst "mexican" restaurant I have ever eaten at! Thankfully my fiance and I had our entrees comped as part of a show we were seeing, but even then I felt ripped off by what we did pay for (chips, salsa, guacamole, a margarita, and jalapenos in one of our burritos). There was zero spice, heat or flavor in any of the food, with no peppers in anything except the jalapenos we'd ordered, but even those had been deseeded and washed so they had no spice at all. There was only the barest hint of cilantro in the salsa, and the guacamole was essentially just mashed avocado with a pinch of diced tomatos and white onions thrown in. The burritos were poorly wrapped, falling apart immediately, and poorly assembled, with only a dollop of sour cream and guacamole in the very center of them, so the dominant flavors were of essentially unseasoned rice, beans and meat, the salsa only adding texture with no flavor or kick. The margarita tasted and felt like it had no tequila in it as well. We asked if they had spicier salsa and they did not. All in all this was the blandest, most unsatisfying mexican meal I have ever had, and it was vastly overpriced; the only positive thing I can say is that it was warm and took up space in my stomach.

Also, they have a "California Burrito" on the menu which is a lie; theirs is merely a vegetarian burrito, not an actual California Burrito which is a carne asada burrito with the works and fries inside.

This review is for the $4.79 breakfast. Had it today and I definitely will have it on future Vegas trips. Quick, efficient service and the food was good. The tortillas and bacon were particularly tasty. The potatoes were average, and so was the sausage patty but for $4.79 who cares. My husband got a $4.95 mimosa. It was pretty small but he said it was good. Highly recommend this place for a cheap yummy breakfast!!
Love the breakfast options! Great atmosphere to sit quickly before heading out for a long day at the convention center. Light and heavier options available with pretty good service.

Food and service was good. Location outside near the fountain is nice. Had the Fresca Salad with carne asada. Stopped their to eat because the Border Grill was closed for a private party. No complaints but wouldn't make a special trip to eat their either.

The food was mediocre. It was Mexican food that shouldn't have been too hard to mess up, yet nothing was super great. The real issue was our waitress. She was rude, couldn't remember simple requests (the salsa to go with the chips we ordered, if we ordered a single soda in our group of four, silverware for the table, etc.). Had the restaurant been busy, this would have been more understandable. At one point, she handed one of our entrees off to another server so she didn't even have to come to our table again. Very unimpressed.

I was in the mood for Mexican and immediately when I saw this place, my boyfriend and I decided to check it out.  We both were disappointed.  First, our waitress took awhile to ask us what we wanted to drink.  Then, we stated we needed additional time to look at the menu and I kid you not, she gave us 30 second (no joke) and came back to see if we were ready.  We stated no, we needed a few minutes, and she came back 1 minute later, and we just kinda looked at her confused, why was she rushing us to order?

Then, we made our decision, closed our menus and waited over 15 minutes for her to take our order (and the restaurant was not business).

You have to pay for Chips and Salsa - which was so-so.  I ended up ordering a Steak Burrito and it came with Rice/Beans.  The rice and beans were not tasty and the burrito was stuffed with the same rice and beans and barely any meat.  Did not enjoy.  Also, our waitress never came to the table to ask us for refills or even for the bill.  After finishing our meal, we probably waited 15-20 minutes before flagging her down asking for the bill.  Mind you it still was not busy.  I will definitely not be back to this restaurant.
Low cost food.  Low quality food.  Slow service.  Sugar water for tea.  Cheap breakfast special.  Dirty restaurant.  Bathrooms are filthy.  Baby changing table in bathroom disgusting.  I could go on.

Came here again because I loved it so much but they disappointed me my second time here which was the morning after! So we were seated fast but it took around 5 min to order our drinks and 10 min for the waitress to take our order and I ordered coffee and they forgot to give me sugar... I asked for sugar and they gave it to me 10 min later... 
They gave us our food 30 min after we ordered and when we got the food it was such a smaller portion from the previous day and my eggs were cold!!!! I might never come back...

This place is our breakfast spot when staying at Planet Hollywood. For 4 dollars you get 2 eggs, bacon (or ham or sausage), potatos, and tortillas (before 11 am). Our server was really nice and the food tasted good enough. The coffee however, was pretty terrible. Totally watered down. I also had dinner here before. I had the shrimp fajitas and they were pretty good. If you stick with the basic you'll be fine. Easy and quick place to eat.
Came here for 3.99 breakfast ! I ended up getting steak and eggs wife got chillaquilles.Food Was good..service was fast.good place to eat bkfast and not expensive

I was stranded at PH around dinner time so we went to La Salsa. I ordered a margarita on the rocks and the server informed me that there was a $3 special on frozen. Normally I'm not a fan because I feel like frozen drinks are a good way to get stiffed on alcohol but a $3 drink is a $3 drink so I got it. I appreciated him saying that there was a special going on since they don't have signs announcing their happy hours. 

I ordered enchiladas suizas, and like other Yelpers have said, it isn't that authentic or that great. It was edible but it wasn't a place I would recommend. Again like others have said, somewhat pricey for smallish portions. Once but not a repeat place.

Skip this place!!!

Strawberry margarita is in a 16oz glass that's $13 and just tasted like a sugary strawberry slushy. I asked where the alcohol was and the waitress just said its because you ordered strawberry flavored. Ummm, no. She wanted to charge $1 extra for another shot. So, I just cancelled and ordered water. 

My food: a flavorless steak taco with a chicken enchilada that tasted like it was frozen. 
Overall: overpriced and most importantly not good! :(

Please stop by and eat here! We will take our time when we serve you.  You will get your water and coffee 30 mins after you sit down.  Once you and your friends and families get done eating we will ensure that all of you have diarrhea and we say have nice day.

Coming to this location for a delicious dinner before gambling and a show. This place did not fail to please! Our waiter, Ismael and knowledgable bartender, Aileen provided us with a memorable dining experience. We were in a bit of a rush but they got our drinks, appetizers and food out quickly and exceptionally cooked. The guacamole is to die for and their tequila selection is one to beat the band. La Salsa exceeded our expectations and accommodated us like no other! A must try for Mexican places in Vegas! Love it!!

Hit or miss service. Sometimes if you're lucky there's someone paying attention at the front of the business but if you're not aware and walk right inside without them seeing you you'll be standing there without help for awhile. On occasion they have really friendly and outgoing staff that seems to get my orders correct and then there's the ho hum servers that can't seem to get it right. You definitely notice the correlation and if you return you learn who to avoid if possible. Last trip they were unaccommodating when they left the sour cream out of my califronia burrito leaving it bland and dry. I went back and politely asked if I could get a side of it since they forgot to add it and they told me its $1.50 extra for some sour cream. The other Mexican food place in this mall hardly charges that much for fresh guacamole let alone a scoop of dairy. Typically the food is good though but again it all depends on the server.

Came in for lunch and everything was great from the food to the customer service. Ordered the Cantina Sampler and a Margarita. I'm not a drinker so, I was very pleased that it wasn't too strong. The food came out hot and liked delicious.  I'd go back on my next visit. Only thing I didn't care for is someone asking if we wanted a FREE souvenir picture. She said FREE at least three times then came back with 2 large framed pictures for purchase $20. We declined and she pressed on a couple times. We declined again and see gave us a small complimentary  picture.

Bigger place than appears from outside. Good size proportions.  Fairly priced!  Had good service. Food tasted good. Wife's avacado green sauce chicken enchiladas were good.  No free chips and salsa but meals came quick.

The $4.79 breakfast is worth it. Bacon, eggs, home fries and tortilla. Cooked well, food came fast and defintiely get the bloody mary, but upgrade to the $2 one...perfectly spicy. Javier was nice and even a jokester. For a place on strip...worth it...do yourself a favor and go to this place...you will thank me later. Tell them AJ sent ya and you may get a free shot of tequila.

This place has such an amazing location, except I ate here at night at the patio didn't even have gas for their heaters!! Sorry but it's 50 degrees at night, but why wouldn't I want to sit outside to see the beautiful city! The staff also didn't not help us find a table, they were sitting in the booths and asked what we were doing when we were walking to the patio to eat. She must have been the manager, she said she was so sorry when we told her we're going to eat on the patio. Finally the margaritas were a rip off! Literally 11$ for a small plastic water glass! I don't understand how this place is still in business when it doesn't attract anyone, the staff is rude!  
The food was good though, but the staff ruined it for me.
These guys have the best $4.95 breakfast around, I ate here every morning. Two eggs to order, choice of meat, kick ass hash brown and they even throw in a couple flour tortillas.

It was ok.  First off, I will give it up to the service.  It was outstanding and very friendly. We had a party of four and the waiter never had to write anything down and our food and drinks were all correct for the entire meal. 

I went with the Mexican city tacos. 3 soft corn tortillas (doubled up) I had two chicken and one carne asada.  The carne asada was my favorite.  The chicken tasted good, just wish the chicken had a little more flavor. These carne asada was really good and meat was tender.  Especially if you get the "really" hot salsa, which was pretty much just straight habanero juice.  I ordered rice as my side but some of the rice was uncooked!  No bueno. 

They had a nice little bar and we all ordered Titos on the rocks, which can't really say anything negative about.

We stopped here for a quick dinner on Saturday night...the place was empty! Now, I'm use to the La Salsa back in San Diego that is a fast food place, so this seemed pretty pricey to me for basically the same food. My husband had the Fajita Quesadilla and I had the chicken burrito. Both we good but not excellent. We also ordered the chips and salsa (which I hated paying $2.50 for...who doesn't give free chips!!) and I had a strawberry margarita which was decent. It was an okay dinner, but not worth the $$!
Its took almost 3 years, but I finally made it back to Vegas and got La Salsa Cantina's famous mango margarita.  The drink was $11, but for the size and taste it was well worth it.
Steak and chicken is not real whatsoever.. Stay away from this place.. it's a very low budget quality steak and chicken. It didn't even taste like real meat...

Well I had my heart set on mexican one evening when we were in Vegas. My husband and I decided to try La Salsa Cantina. I had the burrito while he had the chimichunga. We both drank margaritas and lets just say that they margaritas were SOOOO much better than the food. We have a local mexican chain here in town (Columbus) that is SOOOOOOOOOOOOOO much better than this place. I was really disappointed. It almost seemed like they forgot to season the food at La Salsa Cantina. What a disappointment in food and price.  Also, the food is WAY overpriced here too. Go elsewhere!!!

$3.95 breakfast right next to our hotel?! Yes, please!  Two eggs, choice of meat, American fries and tortolla(or toast) and 99 cent margaritas to boot!  Great price for the strip...eggs were fresh and delicious.

We probably won't go here for any other meals.  The decor reminds me of a low budget señor frogs and there's a dj booth...which doesn't float my boat.  

Service was fast and friendly.  He even remembered our order the second day we went in!

This is not gourmet dining but standard average ameri-mexi food served with really great drinks. I had an Italian margarita (made with Amaretto Disaronno) and much better than tequila and small and sweet enough to really enjoy. Food was fresh and tasty but nothing really special; portions large. For instance, I had chipotle shrimp salad which had lots of fresh lettuce, corn and tomatoes and plenty of nicely spiced shrimp but the shrimp were frozen and then cooked (but not done too badly). Atmosphere is lively and the location is handy (near MGM etc.). We had to demand service as the wait staff seem overly occupied in something else but once they realized we wanted drinks and food, they moved. Probably won't go here again as it's just not good enough for the price charged (except maybe go in for a drink and the music which I understand happens later).

This place has become our favorite, a little hidden away off the strip inside Caesars, cheap great breakfasts tht include a beer, mimosa or tequila sunrise! You can't beat that! Breakfasts include a meat, fried potatoes and eggs any way, they also have Chalulas Hot sauce :) Kitchen is fast so you'll be back on the strip to gamble or get ready for the pool! Can't wait to go back April 29th to chow down!

Damn, this place is overpriced. I got two burritos and a couple of drinks and the bill was $65!!!! Are you kidding me?? Then, I ordered a yard drink to go, and I swear, there was NO alcohol in it. I am a lightweight so I should have been drunk drinking the entire thing, but I drank it and didn't get drunk. Really?? The upside of this place is that the servers are really nice and the food is decent, but everything else about this place pissed me off.
We ate here for breakfast. Restaurant was half full. Food was good but it took about 20 mins to get it out. In addition waitress was not responsive.

I feel sorry for anyone that eats the breakfast here. 

In a hungover state, my friend and I were lured in by the "$3.95 Breakfast Special" as we passed by this place at Planet Hollywood. We were seated right away and was surrounded by the generic "cantina" atmosphere. 

I had a gut feeling the "$3.95" special wouldn't taste good so I took a chance with the steak n' eggs. It took them 20+minutes to get our orders with no apology. My dish had no soul, it was tasteless and disgusting. She asked me three times if I wanted a refill on my Bailey's and Coffee within a span of 5 minutes. 

Place is awful, you guys should try harder if you want to keep on paying that overhead to stay at Planet Hollywood.
Thia place is actually very good! The food is delicious, the breakfast is really good and very cheap and also the lunch! Even the customer service is real good. Definitely recommend.

Best breakfast for the buck! $5.95 same breakfast as $26 in Ceasars. We also had lunch appetizers. Homemade guacamole, generous portion very tasty but the queso poblano stole the show. Generous portion of creamy queso served with fresh chips and salsa. More than we could eat. Drinks are also very cheap. Margaritas for $5. 
All three time we visited, the servers were very pleasant and all orders brought out quickly. Great outdoor patio for people watching. Just off Las Vegas blvd and in Forum shops. Check it out and you'll have extra money to party.

The last 2 times we have had lunch there. in March and July. the service is unacceptable.  There is only 1 waiter and a bartender whether inside or outside.   The waiter never brought out request for flour tortillas, never ask us for another round of drinks and after asking twice for the check. returned our credit card ip without a pen to sign.  

We line this location at the forum shops at Caesars better than others because of the outside seating and the menu has more upscale offerings.   The hamburger sliders used to come with a variety of 3 interesting dipping sauces and now comes only with ketchup.
This was a quick spot for lunch at Miracle Mile Mall.  The service was perfect.  The food was good, and it was affordable.
Excellent breakfast place. They have $.99 bloody Mary's and $3.99 breakfast specials. Really good food at cheap prices.

Located in the Planet Hollywood Miracle Mile, this Mexican restaurant is a disappointment at best.  The menu is large and varied, but it is the first Mexican restaurant that charged for chips and salsa instead of providing them free of charge, at least for the first round.  Beer and wine choices are limited.  The Mexican Pizza was large and good.  The Taco salad was a nice portion also, but this is the first Mexican restaurant we've been to that hasn't had ground beef as a protein choice.  Eating here is a nice experience if you are able to sit in the promenade and people watch.  Other than that, nothing special about this place.  NOTE:  We went for breakfast another day, which is the hidden bargain of Las Vegas.  Eggs, bacon, potatoes and tortilla for $4.79!  A lot of food, prepared to order, for a low cost.  This is a must if you are visiting.

I did not eat here but boy oh boy did I drink here 

I think I had two of the tall drinks twice/day while staying in Vegas & I only wanted them from La Salsa 

The bartenders made them fast & strong each time 
Not to mention after making the drink they put extras shots of tequila in them to top things off! 
Now that's my kind of bar, the drinks were around $16 but kept me staggering all night long 

I should have just came here instead of buying drinks at some club that barely uses alcohol in their drinks at all 

Remember in Vegas a little tip goes a long way & also gets you a lot of tequila shots

I'm really surprised I'm able to give a Las Vegas restaurant 5 stars but this place did everything that I want in a restaurant right. 
1. We had a party of 8 at 8pm. We were seated in 10 minutes after being told it would be a 20 minute wait.
2. The drinks were good. Las Vegas pricey. 
3. The food was excellent. I am only going to talk about my experience since our party was so large, I didn't have a chance to ask how everyone else enjoyed it. 
The chips and salsa were great. The chips were puffy and the salsa was not too spicy. I got a ceviche, which was spicy and perfectly seasoned. It was really, really good. I also got the fish tacos which had a really delicious salsa on top. 

We stayed at Bally's this visit and will do so in the future. When we do, we'll definitely come back for another visit.

Got the nachos and substituted the queso dip for regular cheese. Worth the extra charge. Service was slow and unattentive even though it wasn't busy at the time. Food was decent, next time I'm here I'll try the $3.95 breakfast and 99 cent Bloody Mary.

Excellent Vibes
The food was Good, but rather overpriced for what it is... $14 for a grande steak burrito that would normally cost about 8 bucks elsewhere. But its Vegas.

VERY PROFESSIONAL Managerial staff. Handled an issue well and treated us with utmost respect. We left here satisfied because of Bob! Thanks for the help.

Easily one of the worst dining experiences I ever had. The waitress was pleasant but the food was terrible. I am a big guy and this is the first time in memory that I refused to eat ANYTHING on my plate. 

The steak was dry and tough. The rice tasted like store brand like Lipton. Beans gooey. All around mediocre food. 

Avoid this place.

This is a nice casual restaurant that my ladies and I enjoyed before a class we were taking at the V Theater.  They fill you up on fresh salsa and warm, crunchy chips, service is quick and the prices are very cheap for Vegas.  Great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip and have a good cheap meal.

While we were venturing through Miracle Mile stores we had noticed cheap food option promos for La Salsa, Ocean Bar & Blondies. Obviously, Blondies was out of the question with the kid. So, we checked out Ocean Bar and La Salsa to save a buck, or so we thought. 

We had dinner here Tuesday night. 

We ordered the following:
Enchilada with Roja Sauce
Chicken Fajita Burrito w/ no beans.
Chicken Fingers
Mango Margarita

Total with tax and tips came to $64.00

Pros:
Fajita burrito was different. Mrs. liked her Enchilada very much. (+1)
Mango Margarita was refreshing. (+1)
Can seat outside and watch the small fountain show. 

Cons:
Service was lacking. Water was not refilled. 
Expensive for portions of food. Like $6.00 more per item expensive for the portions. (-1)

Disgusting! It was our first afternoon in Vegas and we were told this restaurant was good. It wasn't. First off you have to pay for chips and salsa and maybe I expect it to be free cause I'm from California. Either way the chips were stale. My wife's enchiladas had no flavor. My burrito was no better. When we left the restaurant we were both feeling sick, no one threw up but we didn't feel well the rest of the night. Don't waste your time coming here, Vegas has so many other places to choose from

Another so-so meal in Vegas.  First off, we had to ask for and pay for chips and salsa...really?  Then, we split a late night sampler platter and after drinks, you would think it would taste oh so good.  Not the case.  Makes me wonder how bad it would have been had I been completely sober.  Overall, the service was good and the food was edible.

Maybe because, I'm from San Diego? I dunno I went here for a brunch, and it is a bar as well as a resturant, but the food just lacked. It wasn't even the hole in the wall mexican good, it was the good to Walmart buy a taco kit and some eggs n' call it a day. They have a large drinking "glass" that you can get yourself plastered with, but it's just . .  eh, the only thing entertaining is some of the decor and people watching.

How can you beat $3.95 breakfast?  $.99 Bloody Mary (small but what did you expect?)

I would definitely go back again
I get there around 10 AM. Many empty tables. And there's a waiting list. Yeah... no. I'm ONE person, too. That's poor. Got my food to go.

Hmm... all less than 3 stars huh... I wonder if this is the same one I am talking about. 

But regardless... they get 4 from me cause I bought one drink... ya you know those tall ones - Yard Stick. Yaaa... that one. And it had me buzzing. Thank you Miss Brandi for such a magnificent drink. Never had I tasted such a powerful and pungent Long Island Iced Tea. 

Viva La Salsa Cantina!

La Salsa has been a safe bet for vegetarians and folks looking wholesome fast-food. But this La Salsa Catina inside a mall was dire. The service was fairly ok. But the food was poor. The pizza veggie with black beans tasted as bad as it sounds ;) My sizzling chicken fajitas were ok, but overall we left feeling we should've gone somewhere else.

Damn those vegetarians - it's sooo difficult to take them anywhere! Please eat eggs, fish or seafood...else bring a picnic of straw :)

I Had the carne asada and my wife had fajitas both were very small portions I left more of the meat on the plate then I ate because I was not able to chew it frozen margaritas were from a machine and what Mexican restaurant doesn't put chips and salsa on the table we will never eat there again service was only so so also

I'd consider this a hidden hot spot inside the Miracle Mile shops. We were staying nearby and noticed one of their ads for a breakfast special while walking through the mall. This had to be the best valued breakfast on the strip! 2 eggs, 2 bacon(sausage or ham), potatoes w/peppers+onions and 2 tortillas of your choice for $4.79. They also had $.99 bloody mary's, which sound like they should be awful but were surprisingly decent. We were satisfied enough with our meal we went back a second time. 
Service was friendly but did get a bit slow once the place started getting busy. As a side note, they charge a fee for using a credit card, ours was $.29 so I'd guess it's based on your total tab, not a huge deal since the food was so reasonable.

Can I say GROSS? This place is so not Mexican food that I cannot even believe I wasted money here. The only okay dish was their chips and salsa. Do not order the enchilada suiza. It tastes nasty and do not order their beans and rice. Terrible and more terrible. Can I say more? NO!
Great margaritas and an extra shot of tequila for a dollar more.  Great place to hang and chill.  Waitress was sweet and personable.  Food was good and margaritas were great!

Love the salsa selection they give you and some great queso. The fish tacos was very good. Small place and was too hot to eat outside (dead of summer) but I imagine on nicer days, that would be great.

My group really wanted Mexican food for dinner and we're too tired to stray far from our hotel. We ended up at the Planet Hollywood mall and decided to go to La Salsa. We all  ordered the chicken fajitas.

The food was good but there were a couple issues. Our waitress was really hard to get a hold of. After our food was dropped off she didn't come to check on us to see if we needed anything. We ended up having to ask the busboy for help whenever we needed something. 

Also I thought it was cheap that they charge you for chips and salsa. This is a Mexican restaurant, chips and salsa should come with your meal. It's like going to an Italian restaurant and not being offered bread.

We only came here because everyone was hungry and the prices at Cheeseburger (a close by restaurant) looked a little high.

Turns out the prices at this place are higher and the food was probably not as good as it would have been if we went somewhere else!
I wasn't very hungry so I just got a Mexican Pizza (appetizer).  I paid way too much (over $10) for a burnt, flavorless pizza.  

Taco Bell has better food than this place!!

I wouldn't go back!!!  And I don't recommend anyone else go!

This location is fabulous especially right next to the theater, my reasons for giving only 3 stars. Had nothing to do with services, it was allllll about the food. The chicken fajita salad needs more work. It was sooooo basic should of had black beans added to it. The dressing is horrible maybe a Cilantro ranch dressing would of made it better. The cheese looks fake.. every Mexican place I ever been to they give you free salsa and chips here you have to pay $4 which is fine im not a cheap woman when it comes to eating great food but the flavoring in everything was bland. My mom makes better Mexican food.. hopefully the chef & owners redo the menu put some love into ur food... This location is a hit but the food needs to match... great happy hour margaritas..ill be back in a few months to see if anything changes it not. Ill never come back again..

This is where our Vegas shenanigans began.  We're just walking the strip looking for some outdoor seating to kick off our vacation with some food and drink.  The patio space here is oddly shaped.  It is elongated on the left side of the large Zeus fountain in front of Caesar's.  People are pretty close together and the birds and ducks like to hang here too.  The water from the fountain and the Greek sculptures add a nice aesthetic to dining here which really saves this place.  

The service is okay as well as the food.  -nothing spectacular and really lacks fresh, piquant flavors in real Mexican food- even Tex-Mex.  We had the fish tacos which were edible but pretty flavorless.  The guacamole was okay but tasted just like avocado despite the presence of red onion and tomatoes.  I ordered the poblano pepper with cheese which I thought was cheese inside the pepper.  It's just peppers in cheese dip which was actually one of the better things here.  That fortunately gave my fish taco another dimension of flavors.

I do not recommend you order any fancy mixed cocktails here.  I ordered a top shelf margarita which barely had any of the Herradura white present.  You're better off with a beer or a shot of tequila.  We had shots of Don Julio anejo for $22 which is really reasonable.  The people here are nice enough and will probably try to sell you some fancy cocktails.  

The best part of this place is that it is really right off the strip to people watch, and you get the pleasure of a nice outdoor dining experience.  Have some drinks here and some appetizers, but it's not a good enough place for a satisfying meal.  The food's not festive like a Mexican cantina.  Chevy's does it better.

Save your money and go somewhere else. I came in with a bridal party for brunch today. There were 7 of us but we were assured there wouldnt be a problem. Well, the service sucked for a place that was empty on Friday morning. Our waitress, Gloria, forgot to put in one of our girls orders. So we all get our food and 15 mins pass before we call another Food Runner to come and check on where our missing plate of food is. The food runner comes back and tells us that plate order was never put into the kitchen. She does this as she's holding the receipt. She changes her order to something that might me faster. Still takes another 35 mins for food. I finally walk up and ask where the food is to the manager. The manager, Shirley, then tells me well the other order was made and now we're trying to accommodate the new order. This was a flat out lie. I tell her she was misinformed and she rolls her eyes and continues to be rude. So our waitress brings the plate of food and walks away. My friends pulls the plate closer and yells in pain. The plate was on absolute fire. No warning or anything. We call the waitress back and ask why we weren't warned. I swear we weren't being rude. The waitress said she did tell us and oh well that we didn't hear. So we pay our bill and leave. Granted there's 7 of us at a dead restaurant. We dropped over $200 to be pissed as we walked out. The food wasn't worth it. I had an omelet that was extremely bland with potatoes that were doused in black pepper. I seriously would not recommend this place to anyone. They're rude and lie and not worth saving a buck. If they don't care about a bridal party whose just trying to eat peacefully, they won't care about you.

The $3.95 breakfast and $.99 bloody Mary's pulled us in. It was very good. We ate breakfast for $13 which is awesome on Vegas! Food was tasty. Service was wonderful! For breakfast, its a good decision!

OK, so here's an example of a place not being quite as bad as the reviews... if you order the right thing.

Hungover (I'm sensing a theme here), we headed across the street to La Salsa. Ordered some nachos... not bad and then decided to share the beef fajitas (the server's recommendation).  Really good. Surprisingly awesome, actually. I was shocked. The beef was super tender and really flavorful. 

Though I wouldn't exactly rush back to La Salsa Cantina (service was OK, drinks were OK, the whole experience was "OK"), I would order the beef fajitas again if they were guaranteed to be as wicked good as they were on this occasion. Maybe that's the hangover talking. I dunno. Definitely good eats though.

Ate here twice on our trip to Vegas last week. La Salsa Cantina @ Planet Hollywood Miracle Mile Shops. First trip was good. Food was hot (we had the $3.95 breakfast special and a delicious chorizo breakfast burrito) and service was pretty good. Because of the good experience we opted to come back the next morning. Boy was that a mistake!!!!! 

We waited for our waitress for about 10 minutes before she even greeted us. When we got our meal, two of us had Breakfast burritos with chorizo again. Once I bit into it I had a large piece of burnt (beyond recognition) meat. I took another bite and found more burnt meat. The meat was burnt so bad once you touched it, it crumbled like charcoal. 

I could not tell if at one point it use to be chorizo or breakfast sausage. It was also supposed to come with cheese but it had no cheese. I started to open my burrito and noticed ALL of the meat was completely charred, burnt! The other burrito had NO meat in it except one burnt piece and again no cheese in that burrito either. 

We called the waitress over to show her all of the burnt meat and that one didn't even have meat in it and that they had no cheese wasn't even sure if it they were the right burritos to begin with but whatever they were we weren't going to eat them. She said let me have them make you another one. By this time it had taken so long for us to get our food we weren't really in the mood for it anymore so we told her to just have them make us one burrito and we would share it so we could get on our way out. The rest of our family had already finished their plates by this time and we hadn't even had more than two bites.

She came out with one burrito and it was pretty good. Almost tasted as good as the one the day before but not quite but at least it didn't contain charcoal remnants. Once she gave us the bill she charged us for two burritos. We told her we only ended up eating one so she had to take the other one off. She comes back 5 minutes later and argues that we ordered two burritos. I tell her yes we ordered two but received two badly burnt, unedible burritos and we ended up only eating one after she had the kitchen make us a new one. She said because we had bitten into the first two burritos she was charging us for those. 

I told her if we didn't start to taste it how would we know that the contents inside the burrito were completely burnt? She said well you just shouldn't have eaten it. If our cooks make you two we will charge you for what you order. I said, I don't know who in their right mind will eat burnt food and then pay for it. We refused the plates once we noticed the food was burnt. She continued to argue with us that it didn't matter how the food came out we were going to get charged for what we ordered. I said your problem isn't with me, tell your cooks not to give you burnt food then all will be well. She went ahead and took off one burrito although from the beginning she should have comped both plates and not argued with us when we had digested horrible charcoal for our breakfast.

Skip this place and go elsewhere!
Terrible service. I'm here right now and it's been 20 min and our waitress has not shown...

Great Mexican restaurant inside Planet Hollywood. Affordable,  a lot of food to share, good guacamole and salsa chips, friendly and fast service.  Nice seating area inside and outside, expectantly view. Over all - super satisfied!!!

Always seem to have a good meal here! The there is nothing "Amazing" about the food, but the service is always great. The cost isn't that bad considering you are located in the heart of the strip... If your up to it, try any of the margaritas as they make a top notch drink. I do like Cabo Wabo better, but this is pretty good!

Walked up on a familiar spot and decided to stop. This was a great choice. I haven't seen La Salsa in YEARS! Tried it for the first time in SoCal. This hit the spot.

Ish was my server and he was on point. Informing me of vegetarian options and keeping the refills coming.

I got Chips & Salsa to start. Meh. Chips were good but cut small and the salsa lacked heat and was kinda heavy on the tomatoes.

What WOW'd me was the Grande Burrito. I got it vegetarian style with red and green sauce. It's was stuffed with fajita veggies, cheese, rice, guacamole and sour cream(I should've added queso). I couldn't finish it, trust me, I tried! 

After a few mins I was presented with the choices on the dessert menu. I failed. I ordered the Fried Ice Cream. Never again. The outside coating was stale I think. The ice cream was good but the rest of it was a waste.

Get the burrito but get dessert somewhere else, it's LAS VEGAS for God's sake!

Tacos, fajitas, burritos and more.  A good spot to grab some of these food items, but it was ultimately overpriced and not the best juicy tacos or fajitas that I ever had.

Service was spot on and they have spacious dining area.

Meh.
Love love love the taquitos here. Mexican pizza pretty d*mn good too. Friendly staff. Great patio seating and view of the Miracle Mile's fountains.

We were extremely happy with our meals and the cost... considering that it was on the strip, the price was fantastic! Great happy hour special! (Discovered a 20% off with a fourstar check into the mall) Guacamole was great, fajitas had great flavor.. just enough heat for me, but my man was able to enjoy dinner without calling them wimpy. (Shrimp was a little overcooked) Hector the manager was fantastic as well as Aracely our server!

A place to get your Burrito fix when staying at the Aladdin or maybe cruising down the strip.  This restaurant is located in the Desert Passage shopping center which is attached to the hotel and offers your typical Mexican fare for prices that are the slightest bit overpriced at around $12 for a burrito.  They do serve breakfast until 11, and there is nothing better than a breakfast burrito after a long night (or early morning) in Vegas.

Overpriced average mexican american food.

I already had my reservations about coming here but we wanted some easy mexican food and were too hungry to venture far.  Since this is a la salsa cantina they have a nice setup and drinks but we were only here to eat.  Nothing that really stands out on the menu so most of us ended up with our choice of meat on fajitas.  You only get 2 tortillas with your fajitas which I know is the norm for them but I think is pretty dumb.  Might as well make me two tacos and call it a day.

Fajita Steak - very weak thin slices of beef not sure how you can pass that off as steak.

Fajita Chicken - decently tender and juicy not dried out 

Fajita Pork - shredded pork with pretty good flavor, best out of the meats we had.

Food was average and pretty much what I expected from here.  I am picky about mexican food and prefer a taco street vendor or socal taqueria over the fluffed up american joints.  Overpriced in general and with so much great food around the area really just not worth it.
Pretty good food, horrific service 90% of the time though. Better service at Taco Bell

Food was disgusting. Service was unbearably slow. I've never walked out on my tab, but if a restaurant/ their staff ever deserved such treatment, this place would be it.

Stay away unless you want to be in the bathroom throwing up your lunch. 

BLAH!

SAY WHAT??!! Food for Four Bucks on the strip?! Yes my friends, it does exist :)

$3.95 Breakfast Special like what is listed and blasted all over their reviews... I actually opted for the Egg White and Grilled Chicken BFast...it was only $6.25 pretty goshdarn good, my friend got the $3.95 special and said it was tasty. The tortillas were hard but their eggs were cooked great, the chips and salsa (must purchase for $2.95)  were excellent and the service was great. We sat at the bar, bartender was a super sweet chick and the $0.99 cent Bloody Mary's can be doubled for a whop-pin' total of two bucks and they were really good. 

Go for cheap but not Phenomenal, just good food, super cheap Bloody's and I'm pretty dang sure if you sit at the bar, you not only get better service but you get better drinks :) 

ate here 03/01/2014 at 11am...thank you nice bartender chick...you rock!
ordered 2 carnita tacos with rice/beans. The food was cold and everything was flavorless. The food was gross and super expensive. Maybe the actual restaurant is better.

Admittedly we didn't drink there.....my wife and I just stopped in for a quick lunch while shopping. It is in a well decorated part of the miracle mile shops - lighted painted arched ceilings make the area seem like it's outdoor - very classy. But by contrast the decor of this restaurant was very plain and ordinary. 
The hostess was pleasant and seated us quickly. I was surprised that chips/salsa were not brought to the table. When we asked, we were told we can order them as an appetizer. I believe this is the only Mexican restaurant I have ever been to that didn't provide chips and salsa. But enough about that. On the lunch menu the lunch entrées were in the $12-$17 price range. We scoured the menu but did not find an ala carte menu. We ended up ordering a quesadilla from the appetizer menu and a burrito-bowl-style taco salad. And of corse chips/salsa. Stingy is the only way I can describe their attitude toward the salsa. Very small, very shallow bowls of salsa. It wasn't a huge problem but it was inconvenient to have to repeatedly ask for more salsa. The quesadilla was good. The taco salad was not. There was too much lettuce in the bowl to allow me to actually mix up the ingredients. The lettuce was not cut into mouth sized bites, and overall the salad was dry. It would have been nice to have some sort of Mexican sauce on the salad----something like salsa, for example.
It wasn't horrible, but it was unremarkable other than the anomalies mentioned above. With so so many other choices nearby, this restaurant needs to step up its game. When I come back to Vegas, It will not occur to me to eat here again.
Pleased with this. We went for breakfast and got huevos rancheros. Yummy!
Went for lunch and they had good lunch specials.  I had a chicken burrito and my wife had beef tacos.  Good service, good food, and all for about $25... pretty cheap for the Vegas strip.

Stopped in here with a group of guys during a bachelor party.

Food: It's nothing special, Just Ok.

Price: Expensive for that kind of food, don't drink here or you will pay for it later!

The server we had couldn't split our bills in to individual bills, so she kindly told us that she had to group us together. What a bunch of bull, never heard such a thing. Then the bill comes and we had tip added on...

Not much atmosphere, kind of dark, and just OK food. Service is OK.

Go next door to Cheeseburger Cheeseburger....

Came here for something to absorb all the booze we drank throughout the evening. We settled on nachos & were told by our friendly waiter that it was big enough to share. It sure was!
It really hit the spot for us and we were glad that we picked here to eat.
I would come back since the nachos were very good and the people watching was even better!

We were looking a non expensive place for breakfast walking by the Mile by planet Hollywood and we found this place , a had a burrito breakfast with a Coffee Baileys,  my husband had the $4.79 breakfast .. we were satisfied completely enough .. good service and great atmosphere.

Labeling this as a "Mexican" restaurant is like saying everyone can afford Gucci.

My husband and I each had appetizers, two happy hour beers and chips. Worst $37 spent. The taquitos I had tasted like something out of a frozen dinner meal. They also had no limes for the beers. Really? You're gonna gimmie a lemon instead? Wow. Never again.

Horrible horrible food nasty mexican american food they brung the food to the tables saying be careful the plate is hot. Yes the plate was scorching hot but the food was cold. Boyfriend wanted chicken taquitos they told us we have to wait until 11am to order them this was at 9am I wont return here the service was great as well as the food

Me and my family came here for my birthday before hitting the strip. They sat us immediately which was great because we were starving. The food was okay (nothing extraordinary). However, at the end of our meal the waitress brought out churros "for my birthday" and then charged us for them which we didn't even know until we got the bill! Very rude. Also in the middle of the meal a photographer came around saying the restaurant does complimentary photos, but when she brought us the complimentary one, she wouldn't stop pushing for us to get a bigger picture in a frame which would cost $20! When we politely declined she continued to push us. It was really annoying in the middle of a meal. I probably won't be returning here again unfortunately.

For the family, we went to the La Salsa Cantina location located in Planet Hollywood on the main shopping level, Miracle Mile for a quick bite. The restaurant is located in the back of the mall, so it is a little bit of a walk to get back there.  The 3 of us ordered different selections and each were good.  Unlike their other location at near the M&M factory, they charge for chips and salsa.  Overall, the food was affordable and clean.  The service was okay.

I had a really bad experience coming to this restaurant after sitting my sister because it is a Mexican restaurant spoke in Spanish and the waitress very disrespectful said that it was America and we should speak some English in a very discriminatory tone I was upset about the situation, so I didn't want to eat there I called the manager to tell about my experience and he did not care at all please go somewhere else to eat where u have a good service.
I didn't have a bad experience. I was seated in the courtyard, the food was made quickly and it tasted very good. Was it stellar? nope, but it was just what I wanted and needed.

We eat here every time we visit Vegas and this year was no exception.  
In past years, I would have rated La Salsa as a 4-5 stars.  This time, only 3.
We were here about 2 in the afternoon.  Chips & Salsa are not free....surprise in a Mexican restaurant.  I got a Bloody Mary that was so-so.
They seated us on the outside, in the mall.  Waitress was busy but got us menus.  Took a while to place orders.  Cheese Enchiladas & tacos.  
Food was ok.  Not really spicey (we're from Texas), just ok.
After our meal, we waited and our waitress had been abducted by aliens.
So, we finally flagged down the hostess for our bill.  Another 10 minutes and we got it.  $54.87.  Two lunches + Bloody Mary

Will we eat here again? Probably but much lower expectations!

Ate here for the first time this morning. We came for the $4.79 breakfast and we were pleased. We got here at 1144am and we're told there was a 10 minute wait. The $4.79 special ends at 12 so the first thing I thought was that we were going to be too late and they did it on purpose.  Less than 5 minutes later they called us and sat us right away.  A couple minutes later Jasmine took our order. The drinks came quick. Followed a few minutes later by our food.

I had the Tequila Sunrise which was good and $4.95. Wife had breakfast margarita and said it was alright. We both enjoyed the $4.79 breakfast. It was hot,fresh and just enough to fill us up with no leftovers.  Jasmine was pleasant and checked on us often.

This is adequate, typical, American Mexican. If you're passing by jonesing for a margarita and a fish taco or a burrito... step right up. But if you want something really Mexican... this is not the place. To it's credit it is one of the more reasonably priced places in the Planet Hollywood complex.

I came in for the Happy Hour Margarita special from the hours of 3:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m. The waiter did not explain to me thoroughly exactly what that meant! When we came in, we asked for the house Margarita and I asked for a particular flavor. It was explained to me after I was charged that it only applied to the lemon lime Margarita only!

My wife asked for a Virgin Margarita with Mango, and they charged her an additional $2.25 because they said it was not included in the actual happy hour after the charge! I ordered a Strawberry Margarita for Happy Hour and was not told that it was not part of the Happy Hour special and I was not told that I would be charged $2 extra for the strawberry fruit to be added.

When I spoke with the manager, she told me that they should have explained that to me. It's not anywhere on their advertisement at all! And when I asked for a reduction she said she would only willing to consider it for the Strawberry Margarita only. Not for the Virgin Margarita! They also have a fee charge if you use your debit or credit card for their transaction. I didn't notice that until after I was charged at! She said it was in the menu, but I never even looked at the menu when I ordered the drinks!

I come to Las Vegas quite often. But I would not come back to this location just because I feel that they're not very honest about their policy!

The restaurant is located in the middle of the Miracle Mile mall in the Planet Hollywood. You can dine facing the walkway of the mall and people watch. It is by the fountain that performs hourly starting at noon. 

We went for the $4.50 breakfast special. You get two eggs, bacon, skillet potatoes, and tortillas. It is good quality for the price. We ordered chips and salsa. The chips are served warm and the salsa tasted fresh. It was not spicy. 

Overall, a great value right on the strip!

I didn't expect much, but I must say I was impressed.  The food was better than expected and the service was excellent.  Luckily there is an option of taking an elevator up to the second level to go to the restrooms (your choice of stairs or elevator).  Look up above the bar to see the unique light fixture.

We ate here every day in Vegas for breakfast. I wish I could take the mexican coffee to work every day lol! The 4.25 breakfast is heaven sent! It's over at noon but the staff wi give it to you if you sit down at 11:57! The meal comes with bacon potatoes, 2 eggs  and tortillas or toast. The toast melts in your mouth! The bacon is flavorful and crispy! You can ask for additional bacon. Three specials is 13.00! Can't beat that with a stick!

This was was just ok. Not particularly great. I think Rubio's and Baja Fresh are way better thant his place and have much cheaper prices. BUT.. I had been stubborn to try this place many times b/c of the great music that I hear them playing at the location on the strip. However, on this day about 2 wks ago we were walking the miracle mile shops at hours when they shops were actually open! LOL. We alwys end up here to get a refill for my drink @ Fat Tuesdays when I feel like being a tourist. 

PHOTOS: You cant seem to go to a rest. on the strip w/out beign offered a photo. Well here they took a complimentry photo of us and then offered to sell us a larger one for amt. I think around $10 each. Um, no thanks. I'm @ La Salsa.. not Top of the World or the Paris restaurant.

APPETIZER: Well the chips and salsa is what we ordered. My bf jokingly said... we ordered "CHIPS and salsa...not broken pieces and salsa" Every chip was broken!! IT was like they gave us the crumbs at the bottom of the santitas bag that everyone throws away b/c its not worth trying to find one that you can actually use to pick up any salsa. And IF you do manage to get some you end up w/ it all over ur fingers. BLah!

ENTREE: I ordered the avocado chicken enchilada. which is new on the menu. it tasted ok.. but the chicken wasnt shredded like I thought it would be = and the avocado was basically whole. I asked the waiter if the guacamole had onions, he said yes. SO. I asked for it on the side. He brought it and to my surprise..delightfully, it had no onions! yay!!!! 
IT was delicious. way good. thats why they get 2 stars. no thanks to my uninformative waiter. and the dish said that it came with red or green chile sauce. I asked for red. My dish came with neither. VERY DRY.
So. the took my plate away and gave me a new one that had sauce. just enough to be painted on. well it was better than no sauce. 

We didnt order any drinks b/c at those prices and calories, didnt really feel like I needed any. that.. and we'd already shared a cookie @ toll house down the isle..and wow. .that was a million times better than this place! In fact that was the highlight of the day that afternoon... :) try the cookie!

Great food, great service and convenient location. We stopped here for some food and drinks before the Britney Spears concert. We were sat quickly and had our drinks(beer and shots) within minutes. The food was typical sit down Mexican nothing to write home about but good enough that I don't have any complaints.

Located inside the Miracle Mile Shops.  Place was hopping, nice atmoshere with TV's blaring.  Glenda was our server, very pleasant.  Service was good.  I ordered the California Burrito.  Included black beans inside.  It tasted fresh and good, but not great.  Salsa was excellent, though.
Not a bad place for lunch, I may return when I go into the shops again.

Food came out very quickly after we ordered. They do not offer complimentary chips and salsa which we found odd. The quality of food is pretty standard for this kind of place. Enchiladas were good. We liked that they had Mexican pizza because many places don't. Their taquitos are not vegetarian and are premade, so they were unable to make substitutions for us. The food was not very spicy and their salsa is kind of mild. They have chalula hot sauce but nothing else. They use the same enchilada sauce in many dishes, including their nachos, so if you're not a fan of enchilada sauce I'd stay away. Otherwise, it was fine food and generally fine service.

I had an amazing experience the first time and the second time it was horrible. Should I start with the negative or positive? Well, let me start from my first experience.

I stood outside with my sisters about 5 minutes before breakfast was over. The host greeted us and immediately gave us a table. She left us with the waitress. She asked if we came in for the breakfast special. 

She told us that we had to order before it ends. We all laughed and told her we all wanted the $4.29 breakfast special. She mentioned we can add coffee for only $.99 more.  Of course, we took her on that great offer and added coffee.

She gave us our coffee right away with cream and sugar on the side. The coffee was really good. She then brought our breakfast plates in a matter of minutes. The food was hot and the portion was great! Everything was perfect! The waitress would check up on us and ask if we needed anything else. I was determined to give them 5 stars...

Until the next morning. We were so excited to come back. Great customer service, amazing deal, delicious breakfast all in a beautiful restaurant. What more can I ask for? 

Unfortunately, the second visit was a whole other experience. This time the host did not greet us. We told her we needed a table. She took about 10 minutes to seat us when we noticed a few clean empty tables. 

When we finally were seated the waitress took about 10 minutes just to come and take our drink order. She left took about 5 minutes to get them. She disappeared for another 10 minutes. She finally took our order and it took about 20 minutes to get our food. The eggs were cold. The portions looked smaller. 

I asked for creamer for my coffee and received it when I was almost done. The place started to get packed so when we were done eating we waited for the bill for another 10 minutes. We finally asked the waitress for the bill. We were here for more than an hour and the food didn't even taste the same. It was such a disappointment.

We went here for happy hour while staying at Planet Hollywood. They have an AWESOME happy hour, I was shocked they weren't more crowded. Their margaritas are 3.50 and they have discounted appetizers! It also was exciting because they are listed on AA American Advantage dining program so I got triple the points on my dining experience. This place was great and I will be back!

Paying $18 for THE worst burrito i've ever had?  my fault.

Inexcusably horrible service for an hour and a half?  your fault. 

Don't get it twisted, get Chipotle.

Not a bad place. Food was good, environment was nice. Music messed it up alittle though. I really don't think playing yellow submarine in a Mexican food restaurant is authentic especially when it looked like that's the theme they were going for. Servers are ok but all over the place. All in all not bad.

We came here on a daddy daughter date and thought this place looked cool with the big neon margarita cup on the outside! So we gave it a try! We were promptly seated inside where it had an authentic cantina feel to it. Holes in the wall, shoes on the ceiling, dark lighting and of course Mexican blankets and sombreros along the walls for decor. It definitely had a fun feel to it! 

Our server Vickie was a total sweet heart and recommended the shrimp Sonora tacos for me, and the chipotle shrimp salad for my dad. Let me tell you, her recommendations were spot on for us!! The shrimp tacos were flavorful with the Sonora sauce that had both tang and heat. The shrimp was tastefully seasoned and wrapped in a warm flour tortilla. It was delicious! Apart from my dad having a secret crush on our server ;) the chipotle shrimp salad had also won our hearts to this little spot in planet Hollywood. Everything was great! When the manager Marco had stopped in to check on us, we had nothing but high regards to his wonderful staff and kitchen!! 

We will surely return and will also be bringing our out of town guests here!!

Love the fact that there is no cover, and the music is the kind of music I dig: reggaeton, bachata, cumbia, salsa, and punta.

The dance floor is very small though! A lot of people were dancing and I couldn't even get my groove on because of the constant bumping into people.  :-/

-2 stars for the small dance floor!

Breakfast for $4.95. 

Two eggs. Two pieces of bacon. Some grilled potatoes and two flour tortillas.

Within walking distance of Planet Hollywood. 

Probably the best combination for two hungover San Diegans waking up from a long night of drinking, dancing and starting trouble!

Las Vegas was 110 degrees last week. Everything everywhere was HOT. Even the pools felt like bath water. Slightly less than refreshing, to say the least. To walk the strip mid-day, you had to seek refuge from the scorching heat wave by galavanting through each hotel along the way. Some hotels had misters on their overpriced outdoor bars along Las Vegas Blvd, and this was reason enough to stop for a cold bevvie and a rest in the shade. But I quickly learned that drinks get warm quickly and the water from the misters evaporated before they reached me.
