Disgruntled and sweaty, we walked past the famous fountain at Caesar's Palace. Low and behold, we found our oasis right at Caesar's feet! (Literally right next to that fountain where the ducks hang out.) Lasalsa Cantina advertised on a small chalk sandwich board a bucket of 5 beers for $20 -- mix & match! (Let me tell you, in Vegas, unless you're gambling for free drinks, this is a DEAL!) We sat in the only comfortable outdoor restaurant in all of Las Vegas! There was an indoor option too, but on this small patio, the umbrellas over our tables had misters that were actually low enough to cool us off! 

The food was authentic Mexican cuisine. The guacamole that came with our giant $5 bowl of chips and salsa was freshly made with large chunks of avocado, yuuuummmm! The flautas were the best I've ever had, and everything was spicy, spicy, spicy! Just how I like it!

I'm so glad we literally stumbled upon this hidden gem. Especially in the heat of summer, Lasalsa Cantina was the PERFECT place to cool off!

Good place to go if you need to save money and want a cheap breakfast. They have a breakfast special for $3.95 before noon.

Service - We were seated immediately. Our waitress was very nice and attentive. 

Food - We didn't end up taking advantage of the $3.95 breakfast special. I ordered the chilaquiles con huevos. My boyfriend ordered the burrito ranchero. We also ordered coffee and hot chocolate with kahlua. The food was ok, nothing special. 

Location - Planet Hollywood in the Miracle Mile shops.

Price - The bill was under $25. In my opinion this is a great price for Vegas.

This is a great spot for a quick, cheap breakfast. It's in the back of the Miracle Mile Shops, close to 1 of 2 ABC stores. 

We ate here twice for breakfast. I had the $4.29 special the first time (2 eggs, 1 meat and potatoes). It was ok, but the eggs were drier than I like. The second time, I had huevos rancheros without beans, and it was great! My mom ate the biscuits and gravy and really liked her choice.

Both times, the waitresses we on point. Coffee is only 99 cents. I recommend going here if you are looking to save money on food or want a decent breakfast at 8 am.

Meh....not a huge fan of this place. Just another tex-mex style restaurant for tourists. I had the fish tacos and they came out cold. The chips and salsa were the best part of my experience. I will try out other places when I come back to Planet Hollywood.

My friends and I were catching a show next door at the V Theater and needed something convenient, fast and reasonably tasty and this seemed like it would fit the bill. I'd been to other La Salsa locations in the past and thought they were fine--how bad can you mess up Mexican food anyway? I ordered the bean and cheese burrito that came with a side of beans and rice (more beans, yay!). The burrito was OK, nothing out of the ordinary, but the rice was not only flavorless, it was kind of hard. I'm usually not a fan of the side rice at most Mexican places and this did nothing to change my mind--meh. My bf had ordered the cheese enchiladas but they ended up having chicken in them. Since he's a strict vegetarian he couldn't eat them but we were also running short of time so we just traded instead of trying to send it back (the service was on the slow side). The enchiladas were OK, but again, nothing remarkable. Another thing to add to the meh-ness: we couldn't believe there were no complementary chips and salsa! Am I just a spoiled gringo? Maybe, but isn't that pretty much their specific clientele here? At any rate, we got to fill up before a show and that's about all I can say about this place.

STEPH JUDGEMENT: Strictly for convenience purposes.

Ok... I've got to agree with the majority of the reviews already.  I'm not a huge fan of Mexican food, even though my honey is a spicy Spanish dish, but I do know the difference between ok, good, and great Mexican food.  The food is about 2-2.5 stars.  I ordered the "Grande steak burrito"... it wasn't close to being "grande"  nor could I find much steak a mist all the fillers.  Give me a hold-in-the-wall Mexican dive any day of the week and twice on Sunday's before I would consider eating here again.  

Why the generous 3 stars?  Happy hour drinks were a good deal.  $10.50 for a yard of lime margaritas with a souvenir cup. $1 more for an extra shot.  And $3 draft beers.  Other than that, stick to the apps is my advice until they steal a chef from a Roberto's type joint.   PEACE!

Decent food. Server neglected us when we didn't order alcohol. No free chips and salsa. Good portions. Liked the chicken enchiladas. Overpriced but could be worse for a strip restraunt. Kinda hidden and small. Made a nice lunch. Lots of light and color in the decor.

miracle miles shops at planet hollywood...circular endless walk...la salsa cantina next to the stripper bar...can't miss the gigantic womanly figure holding a pole...taking another drink break...chips and salsa complimentary...taking a mamacita margarita $nine.ninety-five...reposado tequila?...ultra smooth margarita and great taste...enjoying an afternoon rest from long vegas weekend...seated mall patio...tourist watching...people taking pictures next to the tall figure holding pole...sipping a perfect margarita...munching on chips...ahhh

A good $4 breakfast special and 99 cent bloody marys. If you want cheap, decent, and relatively quick this is a good place. If you want indulgent, head over to Hash House A Go Go or one of the better breakfast buffets.

Food was ok !! Chicken wings are delicious !! Guess we just didn't make the best choices when ordering lol ! Margaritas were great and really good 3-7 happy hour place you can't skip Catalina our server was courteous and very very nice ! That along got my 5 star review !  
Keep up the good work !

I eat mexican food quite a bit so i know what good mexican food is and this place didnt disappoint. The service was prompt and our party of 7 got seated after just a few minutes. I ordered the peach mango margarita and a fajitas quesadilla. The chips and salsa for the table is an extra $2.99 but its definitley worth it. 

for a being inside the mircale mile shops and being on the strip it is very fairly priced it was only 30 bucks for two entrees and a margarita.

went to this location this past weekend.... omg last time i was in vegas it was delicious....

this time... ummm it was ok... we got there @ 10:40 am (lunch time doesnt start till 11am) 

by the time the waitress came it was 10:50am.... my husband ordered breakfast(he was still on time)...


and my friend and i wanted lunch.... the waitress said we had to wait till 11....??? :/  its like 10 min. till 11 like blah....


we had to settle for breakfast... :( 

the eggs were blah and the tortillas felt kinda old...... 


 but i got my self a yard margarita(yes @ 11am)  and i didnt even get drunk :( it tasted as if it didnt have alchol boo woo :(
We went after a show at the V.  The food tasted good, and the prices were reasonable for Las Vegas.  We'd go again when we are in Vegas.

I love this place. I always come here to eat or drink while in Vegas. For happy hours they have $2 beers and $9 48oz alcohol mix. The workers are very nice and fuckin awesome. Definitely got to fuck with them. They the real MVP.

Meh.  Mediocre Mexican.  Overpriced, naturally.  The queso dip's pretty solid.  The baja shrimp tacos were rather tasty, but they're by no means jumbo shrimp.  The fish tacos weren't too great.  Pretty sure the fish was mahi-mahi, but it was hella overcooked and the seasoning just wasn't working...

This was place was terrible. We waited well over an hour for our food - seemed obvious that the waiter forgot to ring in our order as all the other tables were fed before us. When the food finally did come, the order was wrong and the food was borderline inedible. I've got to think my experience was a slight aberration because everyone else seems to like this place. Maybe you'll have better luck than we did, but I won't be risking a meal here again in the future. Just walk another hundred feet and get better quality food at lower prices from Chipotle.
Don't waste your time, go to the Costco business center and buy the same scrappy food there.
Standard Mexican chain food, it's good and priced decent.  I go back often and will continue too.  Sit at the bar and ask for Brandon, great service for such a busy place.

Pretty basic tacos, wish we had tried Nacho Daddy instead. We were here during happy hour but no HH deals on food.

Ambiance is the best part about this place because we were able to sit "outside" near the walkway of the Miracle Mile Shops where there are pretty sky-painted ceilings.

I got the Baja Style Shrimp Tacos, and Bryan got Grilled Baja Fish Tacos. I think mine was slightly better than his, because the shrimp (4 little pieces per taco) at least had juicy/salty sauteed seasoning. He complained that his fish (1 piece per taco) was dry. Also, there aren't free chips and salsa.

Fantastic food, frosty drinks, fabulous service! I will say I don't like paying for chips & salsa in a Mexican place, but other than that our visit was perfect! We ordered drinks & apps before Britney & we had food before drinks! And because it's the strip, we got to take our drinks to go! Gabby and Jasmine were amazing! You should definitely give this place a shot! We want to go back for breakfast!

Monica the server could not answer anything about food containing gluten and didn't seem like she care
My friend has extreme reaction and I was annoyed that she didn't even bother asking someone
Love the atmosphere, and the service was fast, food was very good an delicious, a must stop at in Vegas,,,

Yum! Good service and tasty food at a reasonable price. Had dinner and drinks before seeing Zombie Burlesque next door. Happy hour margaritas are a great deal! Nothing fancy and kinda loud, but we were happy and fed. Would return.

Okay, if you're in Vegas eating on a budget.... I would HIGHLY suggest stopping in for at least breakfast! I think we paid 3.95 for eggs, your choice of either ham, bacon, or sausage, potatoes and fresh tortillas. How do you go wrong with that? Everything tasted delicious too... Maybe that's because we started drinking at 6am... Hahaha 
They do have 99 cent bloody marys during breakfast too... So it's definitely a smart spot for a breakfast adult beverage. 
It can get packed in here, but even so, we were greeted quickly. Our food took a little longer to get to us, but for a complete meal under 10 dollars including tip out you can't be too picky. Making this a pit stop every time in Vegas!

Yeah, 2-3 stars describes the food
1 star for the prices
4.5-5 describes our server Aracely
Very basic Mexican food.  Good, filling.  Not exciting but good in a pinch.

We came here for breakfast and the food was delicious. They had mimosas and some other breakfast drinks for $4.95. The mimosa was very good and they also had 0.99 Bloody Mary- which I did not try. A photographer takes your picture and offers you to buy them with paper frames or without- we bought them without the paper frames 2 pictures for $10. The service was not the best as our waitress was not very attentive which is the reason for the lower rating. Overall I would recommend this spot for breakfast in Vegas.

Food- great tasting food! big portions- enough to bring back to your room to eat at 4am when you're starving! 

Drinks- Awesome drink specials during happy hour! Cheap shots and margaritas are refreshing!

Location- Ideal! Located in the Miracle Mile shops, it's perfect if you stay at the Elara like we do!

Service- awesome! I really felt taken care of. We were seated right away and our server was very attentive. We never had to try to get her attention which is always a plus.

Cost- Vegas is expensive, but this place won't break your wallet. With the big portions you can take what you don't finish and eat it later. And of course- did I mention the drink specials?

Sure, this is a chain Mexican restaurant- but this place does a solid job and they deserve a 5 star rating.
Hmmm... I have better but it's Vegas and its on the strip so pretty decent. Little pricy but DUH... Beside that nothing special.

This is a breakfast review. After reading this review you should read my review for Planet Dailies.
Denver Omelette had large diced onion, green and red peppers with smaller pieces of ham smothered in co-jack cheese. The meal also had fried potatoes with onion and peppers, so good and pinto beans. This was $8.25.

My wife had the breakfast quesadilla with bacon, she said it was the best. It came with the fried potatoes and an excellent fresh salsa. Only $8.75

I recommend that you sit outside looking at the people walking the Miracle Mile for entertainment.

I regret there are no pictures, I am that guy that always takes a picture of my food. We slept in and by the time we got to the restaurant I was starving. I took the first bite and ruined the photo op. I may go back tomorrow for the same breakfast.
Service was one step above a cafeteria, drinks were ok. My food was good but My friend got food poisoning after eating here. Beware of the re-fried beans... not only here but anywhere you eat them!

I actually returned my .99c bloody mary because it was so thick and taste like ketchup. Seems like someone spilled a bottle of powdered garlic in the huevos rancheros. I also hate onions and they were in everything by the handful. Wouldn't recommend ever. My boyfriend is not picky at all and he thought it was gross too. The cheeseburger place next door had greasy breakfast but better than this!

This was pretty good place inside the Miracle Mall, also you get to people watch as well. They have some good main dishes, they were not spicy on the food, they have a challenge, but you need to go and visit them to find out what it is ;-) I would recommend this place if you want to eat on the strip, and they were not priced high either!

I've been here twice for breakfast. Steak and eggs were very good. I enjoyed their 5$ bloody Mary's and tequila sunrises. In all we really like this play, food is great. Service is hit and miss tho, our server wasn't the best and neglected to check on us. However her coworker stepped up and served us properly which saved them from a 4 star review.

I had a very expensive margarita here. I just wanted the experience of walking down the street with a drink, LOL. So I chose a $21 margarita. It was good, but not the best I've had. I finished about 3/4 of it, then tossed it after it melted. Oh well. My husband had a draft Dos Equis--this was the only draft the bar had!  We were a little surprised, but he was fine with it. It looked like a nice little place to get something to eat and drink.

Came here for a quick meal before a night of partying it up =D

Overall enjoyed the food.  Service started out great but ended after we got our food.  No one checked in one us for the last half hour of our meal, and had to flag down someone to ask for our check.  

The food was pretty expensive for a 'la salsa' restaurant, but that may have been because we were in Vegas (prime location - inside the Miracle Mile Shoppes).  We paid approximately $90 including tip for 2 entrees, and 2 drinks which is pretty unreasonable for a fast food chain restaurant.

Other than the price, and the long wait for our check...everything else was satisfactory.

Good cheap food for Vegas.  Make sure you bring cash because they will charge you a fee  to use your debt/credit card.  They are short handed today which caused delay in drinks and food being ordered and received.  Not sure if I would come back.

We stopped at this place for a late breakfast on Thursday morning. I had the chilaquiles. Definitely not what grandma used to make but it was good. It came with eggs, beans and i ordered a side of potatoes. The service was sloooooow. I had a problem with that. It wasn't even that busy and there seems to be plenty of staff.
